Title: Executive Assistant
Description: One of Hauser Recruiting's new clients - a European investment firm - has recently opened their new modern office in prime location in Frankfurt and they seek their first Executive Assistant / Office Manager. Fluency in German and advanced English language skills are essential! This is an established firm with offices throughout Europe, and a start-up feel in Frankfurt. This will suit you if you are an Executive Assistant or Team Assistant, able & happy to work as the team's sole support, with a view to establishing structure. You will work closely with other European business support colleagues, manage the Frankfurt office, and set the standards for future members of the business support team. You should enjoy working in an environment that changes constantly, and no two days will be the same! You should be happy supporting the whole team. My client has plans to double the number of employees in the next year - an exciting time to join in this period of company growth! Because you are responsible for the office as well as providing EA support, this role is office-based 5 days per week. This could be more flexible when the business support team grows. If this is an opportunity that suits your career motivators, what skills should you bring to be considered for the role? Proven history in a European or global financial services / investment business Experience as a Team Assistant or Executive Assistant with diverse duties including diary management, travel organisation, expenses, administration & some office management tasks Advanced, confident communication skills in English & fluency in German - essential Well-structured and independent working style Proactive support, taking on small and large tasks without differentiation Ability to multi-task Ideally some experience of organising team events If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant - stunning, centrally located Frankfurt office! THE CLIENT Our client is a successful, independent investment firm operating across Europe. With a modern, centrally located office in Frankfurt, they operate with a collaborative tight-knit, high-performing team. As the firm continues to grow, they are looking for a reliable and proactive Team Assistant & Receptionist to provide full operational and front-office support to their Frankfurt team. THE ROLE Working alongside a wonderfully supportive Office Manager, the role will be hands-on and varied ideal for someone with a collaborative mindset. As the Team Assistant & Receptionist, you’ll play a pivotal role in keeping the office running smoothly, managing travel, events, and day-to-day coordination. You’ll be the face of the office and a vital support to the wider team — it’s a great opportunity for someone who enjoys being a 'go to' person. Duties will include but are not limited to: Managing and coordinating calendars and travel (national and international) Booking and supporting meetings, video calls, and conference calls Processing expenses for the Frankfurt team Organising team events (e.g. off-sites, team days) Preparing and formatting documents and presentations (Word and PowerPoint) in both German and English Welcoming guests, setting up meeting rooms, and arranging catering Maintaining a presentable reception, kitchen, and communal area Handling daily post, filing, and general office admin Ordering supplies and managing stock inventory Covering for colleagues during holidays Reproducing and binding documents and presentation packs KEY REQUIREMENTS 3+ years’ experience in a similar Team Assistant/Administrative role Fluent in German and English, both spoken and written Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel Excellent organisational and multitasking skills Friendly, dependable, and highly professional Strong attention to detail and the ability to follow procedures Proactive and enthusiastic with a “can-do” attitude Confident communicator, able to liaise comfortably with internal and external stakeholders Experience working across multiple teams BENEFITS Hugely competitive salary and bonus potential, plus benefits including: • Annual discretionary bonus • 30 days’ holiday • Job Ticket • Gym Membership • Bright, modern office in Frankfurt’s city centre • Flat hierarchy and agile working style • A positive team culture that encourages personal ownership and initiative Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant Global Investment Bank Munich, Bavaria We have just picked up a fantastic opportunity to join a global investment bank in Munich! This role is a Team Assistant position joining the firm and another assistant to not support a managing director, but also take on some light office management duties. The team in Munich is absolutely incredible and they also love to get together for social and sporting events to keep the team spirit alive! The culture in this office is unmatched and perfect for someone who is keen to roll up their sleeves, bring energy and positive attitude to the office. German and English are essential in this role as you will be working closely together with other assistants across different offices. You will also get 1 day working from home and a incredible team of colleagues where you will be valued for your contribution! MAIN DUTIES: Assistant – direct support to the Managing Partners & some more junior Investment Professionals based in Munich (full diary management, travel arrangements, secretarial & organisational support) Office Management – overall responsibility for leading the office & ensuring the wider team is supported well and office is running smoothly. Projects – assistance with events & process implementation This is a perfect role to take the next step in your career. The team are very welcoming and supportive, and would like to find a candidate the fits well within their culture. Being well organised with strong communication skills are key. Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Als Executive Assistant (m/w/d) unterstützen Sie zwei Geschäftsleitungen in einer Firmengruppe in organisatorischen, administrativen und operativen Belangen. Mit Ihrem strukturierten Arbeitsstil und Ihrer hohen Kommunikationsfähigkeit sorgen Sie für einen reibungslosen Ablauf im Tagesgeschäft, behalten auch in anspruchsvollen Situationen den Überblick und halten somit der Geschäftsführung den Rücken frei. Kernaufgaben Organisation, Koordination und Protokollierung von internen und externen Besprechungen, Sitzungen und Konferenzen Unterstützung bei der Erstellung und Aufbereitung von Präsentationen, Vorträgen und Reden Verantwortung für die Terminplanung sowie Koordination und Nachverfolgung organisatorischer Aufgaben Planung, Buchung und Vorbereitung von Geschäftsreisen , einschließlich Reisekostenabrechnungen und Nachbereitung Administrative Unterstützung , insbesondere bei der Pflege und Organisation des Dokumentenmanagementsystems (DMS), sowie unterstützender Tätigkeiten im Bereich buchhaltungsnaher Prozesse. Kommunikation mit und Betreuung von Kunden, Geschäftspartnern und internen Schnittstellen Flexible Unterstützung in jeglichen ad-hoc Themen und Aufgaben Direkter Ansprechpartner für die Geschäftsführung der operativen Gesellschaft, sowie für die Geschäftsführung des Investmentarms Profil Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder vergleichbare Qualifikation Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Assistenz- oder Office-Management-Position Ausgezeichnete organisatorische Fähigkeiten und eine strukturierte, proaktive Arbeitsweise Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office (insbesondere PowerPoint, Word und Outlook) Hohe Diskretion, Zuverlässigkeit und Teamfähigkeit Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Sie sind gerne im Büro und können sich auf eine Wochenarbeitszeit von mindestens 30 Stunden festlegen Kandidaten mit sofortiger Verfügbarkeit werden bevorzugt Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Responsibilities: The Executive Assistant (EA) provides project and business administration support to the search team in all aspects of the search process including: document preparation and management, scheduling and planning of candidate and client interviews and meetings, accounts receivable and accounts payable, expense reporting, correspondence and file management. An integral part of an EA’s role is problem solving within the search execution and administrative process. Specific Responsibilities: Responsible for the administration of the search process for all team search assignments Formatting, editing, proofreading, preparing and transmitting client deliverables Maintaining consultant calendar Preparing travel itineraries for the consultant, client or candidate in any part of the search process Supporting search team with account management and client relationship, including consultant expenses, client invoices/receivables and other financial reports Creating and maintaining an efficient file management and follow-up system for all search processes Maintaining client and candidate communications through scheduling and prioritizing telephone and email communication Verifying degrees of candidates Consistently building strong relationships and good rapport with candidates and clients Maintaining the accuracy, quality and integrity of all search information in the Heidrick & Struggles database Maintaining and developing job-related skills by attending Company learning programs and keeping up-to-date with job/industry-related reading Maintaining client, candidate and companywide confidentiality Contributing to the team and office by providing reception relief and back-up assistance to other EAs May assist with database research and coding of records in collaboration with Associate or Research Associate practice resources Qualifications: High school education required; college degree desired At least five years of administrative experience in roles requiring strong project coordination Demonstrate a business acumen and financial awareness Proficient knowledge of all Microsoft Office products. Minimum keyboarding skills of 60wpm. Experience with proprietary database environments, a plus Excellent communication skills—verbal, written and listening Experience dealing with people at all levels of an organization, getting and giving often complex and sensitive information in both verbal and written communications Professional services experience, a plus Fluency in both German and English Behavioral Competencies: External and internal awareness: Maintains personal contacts across the internal organization and appropriately shares information. Addresses business process issues proactively with other areas, as necessary Analytical Thinking: Develops frameworks to assure that “pros” and “cons” are evaluated, key issues are identified and detailed analysis is synthesized Creative Thinking: Sets a personal example of seeking out new and better ways of doing things Stays open to new ideas and approaches Generates new ideas Client orientation: Constantly hones understanding and responsiveness to internal and external client requirements, goals and issues Self-confidence and determination Manages most situations in a calm, steady, “can-do” manner Demonstrates self-confidence; resilient Demonstrates a focus on results over time; resourceful, tenacious Relationship building Takes the time to maintain relationships and create new ones Driving results: Manages projects, activities and resources according to search and team strategy effectively Sets priorities and reviews progress against goals regularly Multitasks effectively and efficiently Best practice perspective: Seeks to adopt best practices to increase effectiveness and organization competitiveness Eager to participate in the coaching and mentoring of new employees through formal and informal learning programs and relationships Possesses strong personal commitment to quality standards and meeting quality expectations Gives constructive feedback and recommends suggestions for improvement, where appropriate Organizational buy-in: Generates enthusiasm for Company strategies and key initiatives Energizes others with whom he/she is in regular contact Personal Characteristics Available to work Monday through Friday during normal office hours Demonstrates strong business ethics (honesty, integrity, confidentiality, discretion) in all situations Strong team player Maintains composure in fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Displays appropriate sense of humor in the workplace Flexible to work overtime, when needed Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Join our dynamic team in Munich as an Executive Assistant. MERMEC Deutschland is a dynamic and growing company in the rail sector. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and enjoy a variety of responsibilities, in a business unit in growth. We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to provide direct support to our executive management team, particularly the CEO. This role involves a mix of administrative, organizational, and communication responsibilities, requiring strong multitasking skills and discretion. Responsibilities: Provide high-level administrative support to the CEO and executive team Manage calendars, coordinate appointments, and schedule meetings Organize and book business travel (individual and group) Prepare meeting materials, presentations, and internal reports Follow up on meeting action points and deadlines Plan and support internal and external events Handle incoming calls and emails on behalf of the executives Liaise with internal departments and external partners as needed Qualifications: Completed commercial training or similar qualification Experience in executive assistance is an advantage Strong organizational and time-management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities High discretion and sense of responsibility Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Fluent in German and English (written and spoken) Ability to work independently, flexibly, and reliably We are looking forward for you application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Deine Aufgaben: Event- und Reiseplanung Kommunikationsmanagement Organisation von Meetings Prozessoptimierung Unterstützung im Business Development Kalender- und Kontaktpflege Dein Profil: Persönliche Eigenschaften : Einsatzbereitschaft und Teamgeist Kreativität : Kreative Lösungen für komplexe Herausforderungen Anpassungsfähigkeit : Flexibilität in neuen Situationen Sprachkenntnisse : Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Kompetenzen : Kommunikationsgeschick und Organisationstalent Technische Fähigkeiten : MS Office und moderne IT-Technik Deine Benefits: 📝 Unbefristete Festanstellung 🏝️ 30 Tage Urlaub 💻 Flexibles Arbeiten 💪 Kooperation mit Sport- und Fitnessanbietern 💰 Attraktive Bezahlung und Zusatzleistungen 🤓 Gezielte Förderung und Feedback Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Über uns: SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung – wir sind Ihr Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung. Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Sie lieben es, einem Team den Rücken frei zu halten, es zu entlasten und somit am Projekterfolg teilzuhaben? Dann suchen wir SIE! Im Auftrag eines renommierten Private Equity Unternehmens im Herzen Münchens, suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in unbefristeter Festanstellung (in Direktvermittlung, keine Arbeitnehmerüberlassung) eine/n Team Assistant (m/w/d) Ihr zukünftiges Unternehmen im Überblick: München: Unser Kunde zählt zu den weltweit führenden Private Equity Unternehmen mit Sitz im Herzen Münchens / Nähe Odeonsplatz. Verantwortungsbereich: Als Team Assistant (m/w/d) übernehmen Sie die Betreuung und Entlastung ihres Teams sowie die internationale Korrespondenz und sind erster Ansprechpartner intern sowie extern. Die Sicherstellung eines reibungslosen Informationsflusses zwischen internen Fachbereichen und externen Schnittstellen wie Kunden, Lieferanten, Dienstleistern liegt in Ihren Händen. Sie erledigen anspruchsvolle administrative Aufgaben wie Rechnungsstellung, Reisekostenabrechnung, die Koordination der Kalender (Termin- und Reiseplanung) und sorgen dabei für einen effizienten Ablauf aller Termine. Auch die Organisation von internen und externen Konferenzen, Meetings (virtuell/on-site) sowie Veranstaltungen liegt vertrauensvoll in Ihren Händen. Sie unterstützen bei der Erstellung und Aufbereitung von Unterlagen für Besprechungen, wie z.B. Investoren-Meetings und behalten dabei stets einen "kühlen" Kopf. Das wird Ihnen geboten: Eine unbefristete Festanstellung in Direktvermittlung bei einem angesehenen Arbeitgeber (Direktvermittlung, keine Arbeitnehmerüberlassung) Ein attraktiver Standort im Herzen von München Ein hochmoderner Arbeitsplatz Geregelte Arbeitszeiten von Mo – Fr, hybrides Arbeitsmodell Eine sehr gute Einarbeitung in Ihr zukünftiges Aufgabengebiet Ein Arbeitsumfeld, dass sich durch hohen Teamspirit auszeichnet und sich auf Sie freut Ein sehr gutes Gehaltspaket und weitere Benefits, wie z.B. Mitarbeiterkantine, Zuschuss zum Fitness-Studio, In-house Schulungsangebote Fahrtkostenübernahme sowie geschäftsjahresabhängiger Bonus Wir freuen uns auf Kandidaten, die Folgendes mitbringen: Eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum/zur Hotelfachfrau/mann (m/w/d), Management Assistent/in (m/w/d), Fremdsprachenkorrespondenten/in (m/w/d), Europasekretär/in (m/w/d) oder vergleichbare Ausbildung ODER: Ein entsprechend abgeschlossenes Studium, beispielsweise im Bereich Hotelmanagement / Tourismusmanagement / sprachwissenschaftliches Studium Sie verfügen optimalerweise über erste Berufserfahrung oder befinden sich kurz vor Abschluss Ihrer (kaufmännischen) Ausbildung in einer ähnlichen Position in einem international tätigen Umfeld, beispielsweise im Bereich Tourismus, gehobener Gastronomie, Hotellerie, Kreuzfahrtindustrie, Airline/Airport oder einer ähnlichen Dienstleistungsbranche Ihre sehr guten Deutsch- und guten bis sehr guten Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift setzen Sie sicher in Ihrem Berufsalltag ein Sie haben Freude an Ihrer Tätigkeit als Gastgeber & Teamassistenz (m/w/d) und bringen neben erstklassiger Dienstleistungsorientierung stets ein Lächeln mit Der Umgang mit Microsoft Office-Produkten ist Ihnen bestens vertraut Als Team Assistant (m/w/d) zeichnen Sie sich durch eine engagierte und kommunikationsstarke Persönlichkeit mit hohem Teamgeist aus Neugierig geworden? Dann freue ich mich auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen an E: n.linner@symbiorec.de Bei Fragen dürfen Sie sich jederzeit gerne unter T: +49 170 7656292 an mich wenden. Durch die SymBio Recruitment GmbH können Sie eine absolut vertrauliche Behandlung Ihrer Unterlagen erwarten, die nur nach vorheriger Absprache mit Ihnen weitergeleitet werden. Weil Sie uns wichtig sind, erhalten Sie von uns eine persönliche Beratung, die auf Ihre individuellen Karrierebedürfnisse abzielt. Sollte noch nicht die passende Vakanz dabei gewesen sein oder Sie an einem anderen Standort nach einer beruflichen Herausforderung suchen, freue ich mich auf Ihre Initiativ-Bewerbung. Egal, wo Sie in Deutschland beruflich durchstarten möchten – SymBio Recruitment GmbH ist Ihr verlässlicher Partner, der Sie auf Ihrem Weg unterstützt. Entdecken Sie mit uns neue berufliche Perspektiven und erleben Sie, wie wir Ihre Karriere gemeinsam gestalten. Show more Show less

Title: Probationary Officer
Description: This Job Is Provided By Apna.co JOB DISCRIPTION Probationary Officer (MBA Required) - High Financial Branches (Muthoot) Position Title: Probationary Officer Location: High Financial Branches (Across Designated Locations) Salary: 2,67LPA Upto ₹3,10,000 per annum + Performance-based Variables & Incentives Growth Opportunity: Fast-Track Promotion to Assistant Manager About Muthoot: Muthoot Group is one of the most trusted and established names in the financial services sector, offering a wide range of products including gold loans, personal loans, insurance, and wealth management services. We are committed to delivering customer satisfaction, fostering innovation, and offering exceptional growth opportunities to our employees. Position Overview: We are seeking dynamic, results-driven individuals with an MBA (minimum 50%) to join our team as Probationary Officers in our high financial branches. This role is designed to give you exposure to branch management, customer relationship handling, and revenue generation, while offering the potential for fast-track career advancement, with promotion opportunities to Assistant Manager based on performance. Key Responsibilities Branch Operations Management: Oversee and ensure smooth operations at high-performing branches, maintaining compliance with internal policies and regulatory standards. Customer Relationship Management: Build and nurture relationships with existing and new customers, offering tailored financial solutions to meet their needs. Sales & Business Development: Canvassing and sourcing of New Customers to increase Gold loan Business,Drive business generation by actively promoting and selling Muthoot’s financial products and services. Meet and exceed sales targets. Financial Performance Monitoring: Revenue generations through Cross Selling products & Interest Collection Work towards enhancing branch financial performance, improving sales, and implementing strategies to achieve business goals. Team Coordination: Lead and work collaboratively with branch staff, ensuring optimal productivity, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure that all operations adhere to legal, regulatory, and company standards. Identify and manage operational risks effectively. Qualifications & Skills Educational Qualification: MBA (with at least 60% marks) MCOM (with at least 70% marks) Experience: Fresh MBA graduates or candidates with up to 2 years of relevant work experience in banking, finance, or related sectors. Skills: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Knowledge of banking operations, financial products, and services. Good analytical and problem solving abilities. Target-driven and results-oriented approach. Proficiency in MS Office and other financial tools/software. What We Offer: Salary: ₹ 2,67,000 UPTO ₹3,10,000 per annum with additional performance-based variables and incentives. Career Growth: Fast-track promotion to Assistant Manager based on performance and branch success. Training & Development: Extensive training to develop your skills and knowledge for rapid career advancement. Work Environment: A vibrant and collaborative work culture that fosters learning and growth. Interested candidate can send their udated Resume TO Regional Hr KIRAN KUMAR 8074611369 or Mail recruitncni@muthootgroup.com or Walkin & walk out with offer letter on below Addres: Muthoot Finance Ltd.Regional office RV Tower, No:77 / 1 Habibullah Road, T-Nagar Chennai - 600017. VACANCY LOCATIONS:CHENNAI - VIVEKANANDA NAGAR CHENNAI - GOVARDHANAGIRI CHENNAI - MKB NAGAR CHENNAI - AVADI - CTH ROAD CHENNAI-KOLATHUR CHENNAI - MADHAVARAM BAZAR STREET GUMMIDIPOONDI - (TN) UTHUKOTTAI CHENNAI - AYAPPAKKAM CHENNAI - AMBATTUR, VARADARAJAPURAM CHENNAI - THIRUMULLAIVAYAL ARAMBAKKAM PONNERI CHENNAI - KARAYANCHAVADI CHENNAI - VIRUGAMBAKKAM CHENNAI - MOULIVAKKAM THAMARAIPAKKAM CHENNAI - IYYAPPANTHANGAL PONNERI - TALUK OFFICE ROAD PERIYAPALAYAM - TN CHENNAI - VANIANCHATRAM MINJUR (TN) Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: A rare opportunity for an Assistant seeking a varied and dynamic role in Frankfurt's Bankenviertel! It can't be overstated that every day working for this boutique investment firm will be different... This will suit you if you enjoy working in an everchanging environment, adapting to shifting priorities and have the ability to think outside the box. You must have fluent German & advanced English language skills. You'll work alongside the Office Manager / Senior Executive Assistant who is an expert in her field, with more than 20 years supporting at the most senior level, and she is keen to share information, help you to upskill and support your career development. She has a wonderful balance of professionalism and fun - and she's looking for a great teammate! In return, you'll be rewarded with a highly competitive salary, target-driven bonuses, career development and a role that will allow you to add real value. You will enjoy this role if you like working in a smaller (yet very chic!) office environment. This will be office-based 5 days per week during Probezeit, with home office opportunity upon successful completion. The Role You will support the Managing Director, and work very closely with the Senior Executive Assistant / Office Manager to support with office and project management. Core duties include: Calendar coordination & inbox management Travel arrangements Organisation of meetings Preparation of presentations Handling sensitive legal, financial & personnel documentation Expenses, invoicing Arranging events Ad-hoc projects Ensuring the smooth running of the office alongside the Office Manager Covering for the Office Manager when she is away To be considered for this role, these are essential skills and attributes: Demonstrate experience in high-level service-oriented environments (such as completed your Hotelfachfrau/mann Ausbildung in 5* hotels), or worked as an Assistant in a similar boutique environment Demonstrate previous experience working with high-net-worth individuals / senior executives Possess fluent German and advanced English skills Comprehensive MS Office knowledge Excellent organisational and administrative skills Enjoy and work well in an ever-changing environment with moving deadlines Ability to problem-solve and use initiative Possess a professional and calm demeanour Impeccable attention to detail Exercise discretion and confidentiality If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Office Services Assistant
Description: Who You'll Work With You are someone who thrives in a high-performance environment, bringing a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle meaningful challenges that have a real impact. In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we’ll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities to help you quickly broaden your expertise, grow into a well-rounded professional, and contribute to work that truly makes a difference. When you join us, you will have: Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey. A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes. Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Exceptional benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family. Your Impact McKinsey is a global business consultancy that helps organizations achieve sustainable, inclusive growth. We work with clients in the private, public, and social sectors to solve complex problems and create positive change for all involved. We combine bold strategies and transformative technologies to help companies innovate more sustainably, achieve lasting performance improvements, and build workforces that will thrive for this generation and the next. In Germany and Austria, McKinsey has offices in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Cologne, Munich, Stuttgart, and Vienna. Globally, McKinsey teams work in more than 130 cities and 65 countries. At McKinsey, people with diverse career backgrounds work together. In Office Management, they include former translators, flight attendants, and hotel managers. As part of our three-person reception team, you will be the first point of contact in our Berlin office. You will quickly and flexibly help with all organizational tasks and ensure the seamless processing of our services. Among other responsibilities, you will manage room reservations for meetings, ensure optimal room planning, and make sure that every event room is equipped with the required technology. You will competently support colleagues and visitors from Germany and abroad before and after meetings – and provide reliable information at all times. At our switchboard, you will take phone calls and forward them to the correct contact person. In Facility Management, you will assist with various office projects, such as coordinating appointments with suppliers, supporting them during visits, creating key figure analyses, and preparing presentations and meeting minutes. You will also be responsible for administration and organization in the mailroom, including processing incoming and outgoing mail and providing office supplies and IT equipment. In addition, you will take on administrative tasks and process invoices for external services. From the outset, you will take on responsibility for your own special tasks. Together with the team, you will further enhance the high-quality standards of our office. With us, you will find challenging tasks in an exceptionally committed team, with many opportunities for further training and great scope for personal development. In addition to modern offices in exclusive locations and state-of-the-art equipment, we offer other interesting benefits (e.g., free meals) and company-supported health management (e.g., sports offerings). Performance-based compensation and attractive social benefits round out our offer. The position is initially for a fixed term of two years. Your Qualifications and Skills You have completed your commercial professional training, e.g., as a hotel manager, ideally from a reputable hotel business. You have initial experience of reception work, in the hotel industry or in other service industry areas. You demonstrate strong service orientation and an aptitude for dealing with people. You think and act in a structured and conscientious manner and possess excellent communication and teamwork skills. You have excellent organizational skills and can set appropriate priorities. You are reliable and flexible, quick to grasp new concepts, and have good judgment. With your positive demeanor, you remain calm and maintain oversight even in hectic situations. You are fluent in German, have excellent written and spoken English skills, and are experienced at using standard Microsoft Office applications. Ideally, you have a technical understanding and aptitude, enabling you to quickly familiarize yourself with new technologies. Show more Show less

Title: Rezeptionist:In
Description: Über Hogan Lovells Hogan Lovells ist eine der führenden internationalen Anwalts­sozietäten mit mehr als 50 Büros weltweit. In Deutschland sind wir mit Büros in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg und München vertreten. Unsere Mandanten unterstützen wir mit verständlicher, praxis­orientierter und genau auf sie zugeschnittener Rechts­beratung – für alle Fragestellungen. Wir stehen nicht nur für Rechts­beratung auf höchstem Niveau und spannende internationale Mandate, sondern auch für Inclusion, soziales Engagement und eine freundliche Atmosphäre. Wir suchen Mitarbeitende, die nicht nur exzellente Erfahrungen mitbringen, sondern auch persönlich zu uns passen. Zur Verstärkung unseres Rezeptions-Teams suchen wir am Standort Düsseldorf zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n Empfangs­mitarbeiter*in / Rezeptionist (w/m/d) Front Office & Konferenz­bereich Vollzeit / unbefristet / 40 Wochenstunden Die Arbeitszeiten gestalten sich flexibel täglich (Montag-Freitag) zwischen 8:00 Uhr und 20:00 Uhr. Das sympathische und hochmotivierte Team freut sich auf Sie und sorgt für Ihre strukturierte Einarbeitung. Diese spannenden Aufgaben warten auf Sie: Herzlicher und freundlicher Empfang unserer Gäste Eigenverantwortliche Betreuung des gesamten Konferenzzentrums (Backoffice, Frontoffice, Konferenzservice) Sorgfältige Planung und Organisation der Bewirtung unserer Gäste, inklusive der Einholung von Angeboten und der reibungslosen Koordination des Caterings vor Ort Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Events-Team innerhalb der Betreuung von Veranstaltungen Entgegennahme, Weiterleitung und Bearbeitung von Telefonaten in deutscher und englischer Sprache Gewissenhafte Bearbeitung der Ein- und Ausgangspost Selbstständige Erledigung allgemeiner administrativer Aufgaben Diese Qualitäten bringen Sie mit: Abgeschlossene Ausbildung (z. B. im Hotelfach, kaufmännischer Bereich oder Gastronomie) Erste Erfahrungen an der Rezeption wären wünschenswert Ausgeprägtes Organisationstalent, präzise Arbeitsweise sowie Hands-on-Mentalität und professionelles Dienstleistungs­verständnis Lust auf engagiertes Teamwork Sehr gute Umgangsformen; sicheres, freundliches und offenes Auftreten Diskretion und Loyalität Gute, anwendbare MS-Office-Kenntnisse In der Praxis erprobte, sehr gute Deutsch- und Englisch­kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Das können Sie von uns erwarten: Abwechslungsreiche und anspruchs­volle Tätigkeiten nach strukturierter Einarbeitung in kollegialen und hochmotivierten Teams Moderner Arbeitsplatz mit sehr guter öffentlicher Anbindung Dynamische, innovative und respektvolle Unternehmenskultur Zuschuss Vermögenswirksame Leistungen Finanzielle Beteiligung am Mittagessen Urban Sports Club Branchenübliche Vergütung, 30 Tage Jahresurlaub, Jobticket, Corporate Benefits sowie viele Events für die Mitarbeitenden und Wellbeing-Angebote Soziales Engagement (Responsible Business-Programme) Wir sind stolz auf unsere wertschätzende Kultur und die Vielfalt in unserer Kanzlei. Wir begrüßen alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung/Identität. Wichtige Informationen zu Ihrer Bewerbung: Gehen Sie den nächsten Schritt – wir freuen uns auf Sie! Bitte übersenden Sie uns Ihre voll­ständigen Unterlagen (Lebenslauf, Abschluss- und Arbeits­zeugnisse) nebst Angabe Ihres Gehalts­rahmen­wunsches und sonstiger für uns wichtiger Infor­mationen (z. B. Kündi­gungsfrist, Eintritts­termin) direkt über unser Online-Portal. Bei Rückfragen zu dieser Position oder zu unserem Angebot stehen wir Ihnen jederzeit gerne persönlich zur Verfügung. Hogan Lovells International LLP Elisabeth Schütz Recruitment Advisor München muenchen.bewerbung@hoganlovells.com www.hoganlovells.de Show more Show less

Title: Office Administrator
Description: Location: FibreCoat GmbH, Philipsstraße, 8, Aachen, Germany About FibreCoat: FibreCoat is an innovative and fast-growing start-up based in Aachen. We are pioneering high-performance materials that are affordable and sustainable. With a dynamic, international team and a results-driven culture, we are shaping the future of advanced materials for various industries. Job Description: As an Office Administrator at FibreCoat , you will play a key role in keeping our daily operations running smoothly. You will be responsible for supporting administrative processes, coordinating office activities, and assisting various departments to ensure an organised, efficient, and positive work environment. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys variety, takes initiative, and thrives in a growing, fast-paced company. Responsibilities Retrieve, open, and sort physical mail from designated mailboxes Distribute incoming correspondence to the appropriate team members Answer and screen incoming calls to the main office line Monitor, restock, and order kitchen and office supplies as needed Ensure the office and kitchen areas are tidy, organised, and visitor-ready Refill drinks and snacks in communal areas and meeting rooms Water indoor plants regularly to maintain a pleasant office atmosphere Liaise with the landlord to ensure cleaning services are carried out effectively Monitor and maintain general digital mailboxes Support the organisation of internal events Provide general support to the Administration team on day-to-day operations Qualifications Prior experience in office administration or a similar role is a plus Strong organisational and multitasking skills Proficient with MS Office and comfortable with digital tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German is a big plus) Friendly, reliable, and solution-oriented mindset Ability to multitask, organise, and prioritise work What We Offer: The chance to make a tangible impact on sustainable development and innovation in the high-performance materials industry A dynamic and diverse work environment with a collaborative international team Creative freedom and responsibility in a young and growing company Opportunities for personal and professional growth in a rapidly expanding market Competitive salary and benefits package ESOP options ( Employee Stock Ownership Plan ) A modern and welcoming office space Snack bar, team activities, and home office opportunities 30 vacation days per year Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant (m/f/d) Private Equity Firm Munich A global private equity firm in central Munich with a strong team of Assistants is seeking 2 new Executive Assistants / Team Assistants to support investment professionals in a busy firm. These are full secretarial & administrative roles, requiring a strong team player who enjoys working at a fast pace. You must have worked in an international firm or in 5-star hospitality in a support role, for example on reception, administration or events, and speak German & English to a fluent level - this is essential for this role! This firm offers incredible benefits to their employees, in terms of remuneration, well-being, opportunity to travel and work in their European offices, and career progression. They will support you by helping with relocation costs if you are moving to Munich. THE FIRM My client is a global investment firm with offices based in the heart of Munich and all across Europe, Asia and North America. They pride themselves on their values: being respectful, friendly, entrepreneurial, and they operate across a very flat structure. They only invest into firms that will do good, and firms with values aligned to their own, and they are very charitable and care about sustainability (and can prove it!) making this a very special place to work. This is a hugely supportive and collaborative environment, with encouragement to learn more and develop your skill set. THE ROLE You will support 3-5 investment professionals of varying seniority, and you're encouraged to take on wider projects if you would like to. The main duties are: Managing multiple diaries and arranging meetings across time zones Coordinating and booking international travel with often complex itineraries and last minute changes Processing expenses Replying to emails in German and English on behalf of the team Document management (signatures, printing, binding) Occasional event organisation for the local teams Anything ad-hoc that's needed to ensure the job gets done THE CANDIDATE This is an environment that values team work and you must enjoy working in a team. They look for very humble, intelligent, professional and friendly candidates who enjoy a fast paced environment and who want to learn, not afraid to ask questions. To be successful in this role, you must: Be service-oriented, with some experience in a similar administrative or organisational role, or have worked in hospitality / events Possess fluent German and English language skills Be able to build professional relationships Have the ability to prioritise and handle multiple requests Be resilient and calm when there are last-minute changes Be a team player Have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail Have good knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Value the role of an Assistant THE PACKAGE On top of a competitive base salary (in line with experience) there are the following benefits: Hugely generous performance-related bonus Annual salary review Company pay into a private pension Wellness benefits including gym membership Travel to work paid for Mobile phone for business and personal use Home office budget Annual Christmas & Summer parties in Munich & London Annual ski conference Free food and drinks all day, lunch cooked for you onsite 30 days' holiday, plus public holidays Relocation support if you are moving to Munich! If this is for you, please apply today! Show more Show less

Title: Receptionist
Description: About TELUS Digital TELUS Digital focuses on the value of human connection to design, build and deliver high-tech, high-touch customer experiences powered by next-gen digital solutions. With over 50,000 team members and supporting 50+ languages in twenty (20) Countries across North and Central America, Europe and Asia, TELUS Digital empowers customer experience innovation through digital enablement, spirited teamwork, agile thinking and a caring culture that puts customers first. The company's solutions cover customer experience, digital transformation, IT lifecycle, advisory and digital consulting, risk and back-office support. Fueling any stage of company growth, TELUS Digital partners with some of the world’s most disruptive brands from fast-growing tech, financial services, fintech, gaming, travel & hospitality and healthcare industries. TELUS holds a 65% interest in TELUS Digital with Baring Private Equity Asia holding the remaining 35%. Learn more at: telusdigital.com. Position Overview As a receptionist you will be the first point of contact for the company and you will provide administrative support across the organization. You will handle the flow of people through the business and ensure that all receptionist responsibilities are completed accurately and delivered with high quality and in a timely manner. Responsibilities: Welcomes all visitors to TELUS Digital by greeting them, in person or on the telephone in a warm and friendly manner; and announcing them appropriately, answering or referring inquiries Directs visitors by maintaining employee and department directories; giving instructions Maintains security by following procedures and controlling access; monitoring logbook; issuing visitor badges Maintains telecommunication system by following manufacturer's instructions for house phone and console operation Maintains safe and clean reception area by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations. Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Manage reception meeting room bookings Supports the leadership team with any important client/ VIP visits to the building Performs other clerical receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, collating, faxing etc. Liaise with all other departments, our Finance team in particular to raise, maintain and receipt purchase orders as required Perform additional duties such as Team Member directory upkeep Assist in the deployment, collection and management of TELUS Digital assets Ordering taxis for visitors, if requested by management Requirements: Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite Professional appearance Third-level education Must be available to support reception operational hours between 6am -9pm Monday – Friday, on a full-time basis (40 hours per week) Previous experience in a customer-facing role essential Self-starting attitude and self-motivation Responsible and initiative Dynamic person It is advantageous for applicants to be a car owner and hold a full EU/UK Drivers’ License Competencies: Solid communication skills both written and verbal Ability to be resourceful and proactive in dealing with issues that may arise Ability to organise, multitask, prioritise and work under pressure TELUS Digital recognizes and embraces the importance of values in our ever-changing workplace. To be successful, all candidates must demonstrate behaviors that are reflective of our values: We embrace change and initiate opportunity We have a passion for growth We believe in spirited teamwork We have the courage to innovate At TELUS Digital, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. Title: Rezeptionist - "Der Willkommensheißer"*
Description: Mit über 150 Hotels (inkl. gesicherter Pipeline) und mehr als 20.000 Hotelzimmern an über 60 Standorten in Europa ist NOVUM Hospitality eine der größten inhabergeführten Hotelgruppen Europas. Gegründet im Jahr 1988, hat sich das Hamburger Unternehmen unter der Leitung von Chief Executive Officer & Owner David Etmenan zu einem führenden Akteur in der Hotellerie entwickelt und ist bekannt für seine Vielfalt an zentral gelegenen Unterkünften im Midscale und Upper Midscale Segment. Die Unterzeichnung einer Kooperationsvereinbarung mit IHG Hotels & Resorts im April 2024 macht NOVUM Hospitality zu einem der global größten Franchisepartner der IHG. Die Partnerschaft umfasst den Launch des Co-Brands Holiday Inn – the niu sowie die Konversion der übrigen NOVUM Hospitality Eigenmarken. Yggotel, Select Hotels und Novum Hotels werden in die Markenwelt des IHG-Brands Garner integriert. acora Living the City konvertiert zur IHG Extended-Stay-Marke Candlewood Suites. Für beide Marken bedeutet dies zukünftig das Europa-Debüt. www.novum-hospitality.com Garner Hotels by IHG Garner Hotels, die neue Midscale-Marke von IHG Hotels & Resorts, richtet sich an Reisende, die eine entspannte und hochwertige Unterkunft suchen – egal, ob sie geschäftlich oder privat unterwegs sind. Mit dem Versprechen „Easy-going stays that get you on your way“ bietet Garner alles Wesentliche, das preisbewusste Gäste schätzen: eine zentrale Lage, erholsamen Schlaf und ein warmes Frühstück zu einem erschwinglichen Preis. Weitere Informationen zur Marke Garner Hotels gibt es auf der Garner Hotels Website oder unseren Social-Media-Kanälen: Facebook, Twitter und Instagram. Rezeptionist - "Der Willkommensheißer"* ab sofort | Vollzeit 40 Stunden | unbefristet Sie kommen nicht aus der Branche? Nicht schlimm, denn wir freuen uns auf Ihre Sichtweise der Dinge. Anstellungsart: Vollzeit Aufgaben Ihr Aufgabenbereich Als „Willkommensheißer“* sind Sie während der Früh- und Spätschicht erster Ansprechpartner* für unsere Gäste und zuständig für den Empfang, die Beratung und Betreuung. Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehört der Check-In und Check-Out sowie das Reservierungshandling. Professioneller Telefon- und E-Mailverkehr gehören ebenfalls zu Ihrem Tätigkeitsfeld. Profil Das Macht Sie Aus Sie sind ein leidenschaftlicher Gastgeber*, der durch seine empathische und authentische Art stets das Wohl seiner Gäste im Blick behält. Zusätzlich Zeichnen Sie Folgende Merkmale Aus Flexibilität Gastgebermentalität Empathie Teamplayer PC-Affinität Engagement Wir bieten NOVUM Hospitality – Ein Familienunternehmen mit Herz Als Team leben wir unsere Werte und möchten unseren Gästen und Partnern mehr bieten als nur Gastfreundschaft: ein echtes Zuhause auf Zeit. Freiheit Ehrlichkeit Respekt Bedingungslose Liebe Wir schaffen gemeinsam eine Atmosphäre, in der jeder so sein darf, wie er möchte. Ein Umfeld, in dem Offenheit selbstverständlich ist und begegnen allen mit Achtung und Wertschätzung. Unser Unternehmen wächst mit Herzblut und Leidenschaft. Schreib‘ Geschichte mit Garner und be wirb Dich direkt über unseren „Bewerben“-Button. Die Stellenbezeichnung meint nicht die männliche Variante, sondern steht für die geschlechtsneutrale Bezeichnung des Berufs. Willkommen sind Menschen egal welchen Geschlechts, welcher Herkunft, sexuellen Orientierung und Religion. Important note Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered. LNKD1_DE Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Zur Unterstützung unseres Standortes in München suchen wir ein aufgeschlossenes und engagiertes, kommunikationsstarkes Organisationstalent. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass Kooperation und Vertrauen zwischen allen Teammitgliedern die Grundlage für herausragende Ergebnisse sind. Als Team Assistant (m/w/d) ermöglichst Du die reibungslose interne Zusammenarbeit, kommunizierst mit unseren Dienstleistern und Kunden, und entwickelst unsere wachsende Unternehmenskultur: unternehmerisch, leidenschaftlich und respektvoll. Aufgaben Du übernimmst ab dem ersten Tag Verantwortung und erfüllst dabei die folgenden zentralen Funktionen: Verantwortung der Büroorganisation zur Förderung effizienter Teamarbeit Verantwortung für eine ganzheitliche Wohlfühlatmosphäre als Ratgeber des Teams Korrespondenz und Steuerung von Dienstleister*Innen im Bereich Office-Management Unterstützung bei der Vorbereitung, Durchführung und Nachbereitung von Terminen, Veranstaltungen und Events Organisation von Geschenken für Geburtstage oder Feierlichkeiten im Team Termin- und Reisemanagement der Geschäftsleitung Vorbereitende Buchhaltung Eigenständige Bearbeitung der Korrespondenz Gästebetreuung und Bestellwesen Koordination und Unterstützung im Recruiting neuer Talente, sowie Zuarbeit für unser HR Weiterentwicklung der Unternehmenskultur bei Bloom Partners zusammen mit dem Management Team Positionierung unserer Arbeit, Studien und Beiträge auf digitalen Kanälen, bei Partnern und Events Qualifikation Andere Menschen zu unterstützen, bereitet Dir persönliche Freude. Du bist exzellent darin, zu kommunizieren, zu organisieren, gleichzeitig mehrere Bälle in der Luft zu halten hast erste professionelle Erfahrungen in der Unterstützung von Teams in einer dynamischen Umgebung gewinnen können. Idealerweise verfügst du dabei über folgende Eigenschaften: 2-5 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung (z.B. Unternehmensberatung, Start-Ups, Venture Capital, Marketing- oder HR-Funktionen eines Konzerns) Fließende Kenntnisse der deutschen und englischen Sprache in Wort und Schrift Exzellente organisatorische Fähigkeiten – positiv, entspannt und hands-on Strukturiertes Denken kombiniert mit einer positiven Ausstrahlung und einer kundenorientierten Arbeitsweise Empathie, Selbstbewusstsein und Erfahrung zum Aufbau von Vertrauen im Team Die Motivation, Teil einer schnelllebigen, wachsenden und unternehmerischen Beratung zu sein. Benefits WIR BIETEN DIR Eine inspirierende Arbeitsumgebung, in der Du wirklich Einfluss hast und unser Team tatkräftig unterstützt Ownership & die Möglichkeit deine Meinung, deine Fähigkeiten und deine Innovationskraft einzubringen Home Office Flexibilität, inkl. Flexibler Arbeitszeitmodelle Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget Wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt Guter Kununu-Score (4,2) und hohe Weiterempfehlungsrate (88%) Werde Teil von Bloom Partners in München! Title: Executive Assistant - Corporate & Administrative Services
Description: Overview LabConnect improves lives by partnering with pharmaceutical and biotech companies, and clinical research organizations (CROs) to accelerate the development of new medicines around the world. We are an independent, global, one-stop-shop focused on delivering Central Laboratory Services that are tailor-made, timely and flexible to meet the evolving study demands of traditional to increasingly complex trials. Additionally, we provide Functional Service Provider (FSP) Solutions, supporting our clients with scientific and technical expertise, acting as an extension of their team, coordinating all laboratory related needs, advising on strategies for lab data collection and providing end-to-end analytical and logistical solutions. Summary LabConnect EMEA is seeking to hire an organized, motivated and detail-oriented multi-tasker to join our team. You will provide high-level administrative support to the Executive Team, create and manage the operational dashboard and is responsible for several projects within EMEA. You will be working on-site in one of our locations. Duties and Responsibilities Support Executive Director, Global Bio Operations Serve as key liaison between Executive Director, Global Bio Operations and key internal and external partners, clients, institutions, and other stakeholders, providing excellent customer service. Responsible for calendar management, including planning meetings, taking notes, and overseeing the execution of open actions. Coordinate recurring check-ins and communicate with multiple parties to schedule events. Provide high-level operational and administrative support. Complete expense reports, reimbursements, and travel arrangements. Assist in the management of organizational budgets, tracking metrics, and creating dashboards for EMEA operations using SharePoint and Power BI. Manage additional projects for the EMEA region and global initiatives. Organize all meeting logistics: booking meetings, locations, and caterers. Maintain and distribute related documents, e.g., manuals, minutes, rosters, etc. Record minutes during meetings and distribute to members post-meetings. Project Management and Metrics Tracking Lead EMEA and global project management efforts, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Track key metrics and create dashboards in SharePoint to visualize data and support decision-making. Utilize Power BI to analyze data and generate insights for continuous improvement. Additional Information Education, Qualifications And Requirements Equivalent to graduation from a four-year college. Additional professional or administrative experience may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis. A minimum of two years of experience in a comparable role. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially within Excel and Power-BI. Proven track record of excellent follow-through and accountability. Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and execute multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with creating dashboards and project management. Ability to work independently. Willing to travel and work on both location in Swalmen and Cologne. Self-starter with a positive, can-do attitude. Flexible and able to meet changing work needs and demands. Being proactive and anticipating future needs Strong writing, proofreading and verbal communication skills. Excellent time management skills. Language Ability Fluent in English and preferably in Dutch and/or German Read more below and get ready for your next great employment adventure! Some of the Perks our LabConnectors Love: We truly live our values: People First, Quality Focused, Customer Centered, Technology Driven and Accountability Always. The ability to make an impact on a passionate and growing team Great communication on a smaller sized team A market based salary Tools to effectively do your job (laptop, phone reimbursement) In addition to great perks and challenging work assignments, we invest in our people with enriching career growth opportunities. We believe in a friendly and collaborative environment with open lines of communication. Join our team and discover how your work can impact the lives of people all over the world. Title: Rezeptionist:In

Erfahrung mit PMS-Systemen wünschenswert Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse , weitere Sprachen von Vorteil. Sicheres, freundliches Auftreten und eine hohe Serviceorientierung . Belastbarkeit und Organisationsgeschick , auch bei hohem Gästeaufkommen. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Assistentin der Geschäftsführung / Executive Assistant (Hybrid) Private Equity Munich We have recently picked up multiple Executive Assistant roles with our international clients in Munich! All of the roles are supporting senior members of the business such as Partners and Founders with busy diaries, travel, events and huge scope for extra projects. All of our clients are based in central Munich with prime office offices and fantastic benefits such as international company events, annual bonuses and so much more! You must be fluent in both German and English, ideally come from professional services or hospitality and want to take on the challenge in your career by working as an Executive Assistant for a global private equity firm. THE ROLE These roles will be fast-paced supporting busy senior investment professionals and flexibility will be essential. We’re looking for a capable and knowledgeable EAs with strong experience working across multiple time-zones, someone level headed and calm under pressure who is able to liaise effectively with multiple stakeholders and build strong internal relationships. Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Intensive schedule and diary management, including travel arrangement planning Screening and handling all incoming telephone calls in a responsive and timely manner Full secretarial duties, including accurate and efficient filing, typing and preparation of business correspondence, project documents and presentations, and using a variety of software packages to an advanced level Event management Projects and other internal content based work. THE CANDIDATE An ideal candidate for this type of Executive Assistant role will be a highly motivated, adaptable, and organised team-player, who is able to adapt and perform well in a fast-paced environment, whilst also possessing the following skills/experience: Fluent in both written and spoken English and German Excellent secretarial, organisational and problem-solving skills Have a professional, committed attitude and approach Be able to think outside of the main responsibilities to ensure the whole team and office is supported when needed Have 2-5 years of experience in being an Executive Assistant Be a Team Player THE BENEFITS The package is highly competitive with benefits including: Wellness benefits Annual salary reviews Discretionary bonus Interaction between European offices / off sites If this is for you, please apply today! Show more Show less

Title: Assistent:In
Description: Über uns: SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung – wir sind Ihr Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung. Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Im Office-Bereich besetzen wir u.a. für unsere Kunden folgende Positionen - in Voll- und Teilzeit: Fremdsprachenkorrespondenten (m/w/d), Europasekretäre (m/w/d), bi-/trilinguale Assistenzen (m/w/d), Executive/Management Assistants (m/w/d), Personal Assistants (m/w/d), Assistenzen der Geschäftsleitung (m/w/d), Office Manager (m/w/d), Übersetzer (m/w/d), Vorstandsassistenzen (m/w/d), Projektassistenten (m/w/d), Rechtsanwaltsfachangestellte (m/w/d), Rechtsfachwirte (m/w/d), Notarfachangestellte (m/w/d), Teamassistenzen (m/w/d), Patentsanwaltsfachangestellte (m/w/d), Paralegals (m/w/d), Empfangsassistenzen (m/w/d), Front Office Coordinators (m/w/d), EA Manager (m/w/d), Abendsekretäre (m/w/d)... Unsere Kunden sind international tätige Unternehmen verschiedenster Branchen und Größen deutschlandweit , welche wir aktiv bei der Suche nach ausgebildeten Fachkräften (m/w/d) in Voll- und Teilzeit unterstützen. Wir verstehen uns als Brückenbauer zwischen Ihnen und Ihrem zukünftigen Arbeitgeber . Wir freuen uns auf Kandidaten (m/w/d), die Folgendes mitbringen: Eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung als Bürokauffrau/mann (m/w/d), Fremdsprachenkorrespondent/in (m/w/d), Europasekretär/in (m/w/d), Rechtsanwaltsfachangestellte/r (m/w/d), Notar- oder Patentanwaltsfachangestellte/r (m/w/d), Management Assistant (m/w/d), Übersetzer/in (m/w/d), Industriekauffrau/kaufmann (m/w/d), Veranstaltungskauffrau/kaufmann (m/w/d), Hotelkauffrau/mann (m/w/d), Hotelbetriebswirt/in (m/w/d), oder ein betriebswirtschaftliches / sprachwissenschaftliches Studium oder vergleichbare Ausbildung / Erfahrung Erste Erfahrung am Empfang bzw. im Assistenz- / Sekretariatsbereich (gerne auch Quer- oder Berufseinstieg) oder auch fundierte EA Erfahrung, beispielsweise in 1-to-1 Zuordnungen Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse Sichere MS-Office Kenntnisse Ein ausgeprägtes Organisationstalent sowie die Fähigkeit, "viele Bälle gleichzeitig über Wasser zu halten" Eine Arbeitsweise, die sich durch eine hohe Qualität und die Bereitschaft sich in neue Sachverhalte einzuarbeiten, auszeichnet Freude an Ihrem Beruf Tätigkeitsbereich: Sie fungieren gerne als Schnittstelle zwischen verschiedenen Fachbereichen sowie erster Ansprechpartner für Kunden, Dienstleister und Geschäftspartner? Sie arbeiten gerne im internationalen Kontext, möchten erste Berufserfahrung im Empfangs- oder dem Bereich Office Management sammeln oder haben bereits fundierte Erfahrung als Executive Assistant (m/w/d) / Personal Assistant (m/w/d) /Vorstandsassistenz (m/w/d)? Ihre Kollegen bezeichnen Sie als Allround-Talent im Büro? Sie haben Freude an Ihrer Rolle als Office Assistant (m/w/d), bringen eine pro-aktive und dienstleistungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit? Dann suchen wir SIE in direkter Festanstellung (keine Arbeitnehmerüberlassung) für unsere Kunden in den verschiedensten Branchen mit attraktiven Gehalts- und Benefit-Paketen. Neugierig geworden? Dann freue ich mich auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen an E: n.linner@symbiorec.de Bei Fragen dürfen Sie sich jederzeit gerne unter T: +49 170 7656292 an mich wenden. Durch die SymBio Recruitment GmbH können Sie eine absolut vertrauliche Behandlung Ihrer Unterlagen erwarten, die nur nach vorheriger Absprache mit Ihnen weitergeleitet werden. Weil Sie uns wichtig sind, erhalten Sie von uns eine persönliche Beratung, die auf Ihre individuellen Karrierebedürfnisse abzielt. Sollte noch nicht die passende Vakanz dabei gewesen sein oder Sie an einem anderen Standort nach einer beruflichen Herausforderung suchen, freue ich mich auf Ihre Initiativ-Bewerbung. Egal, wo Sie in Deutschland beruflich durchstarten möchten – SymBio Recruitment GmbH ist Ihr verlässlicher Partner, der Sie auf Ihrem Weg unterstützt. Entdecken Sie mit uns neue berufliche Perspektiven und erleben Sie, wie wir Ihre Karriere gemeinsam gestalten. Show more Show less

Title: Office-Manager
Description: Office Manager (m/w/d) in der Immobilien- und Portfolioverwaltung Standort: Berlin Wir sind eine etablierte Immobilien- und Portfolioverwaltung mit einem kleinen, engagierten Team und hochwertigen Mandaten. Zur Unterstützung unseres Tagesgeschäfts suchen wir eine zuverlässige und mitdenkende Persönlichkeit, die unser Büro organisiert, Strukturen schafft und den Überblick behält. ✅ Was Sie mitbringen sollten: Berufserfahrung im Office Management oder in einer Assistenzfunktion Organisationstalent und eine strukturierte, selbstständige Arbeitsweise Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office (insbesondere Outlook, Excel, Word) Kommunikationsstärke, Diskretion und ein freundliches, professionelles Auftreten Interesse an Themen rund um Immobilienverwaltung ist von Vorteil 🧭 Ihre Aufgaben bei uns: Allgemeine Büroorganisation und administrative Unterstützung der Geschäftsleitung Koordination von Terminen, Besprechungen und internen Abläufen Kommunikation mit Eigentümern, Dienstleistern und Partnern Vor- und Nachbereitung von Unterlagen, Präsentationen und Reports Unterstützung bei Projekten und organisatorischen Sonderaufgaben Pflege und Verwaltung interner Dokumente, Akten und Datenbanken 🌟 Was Sie bei uns erwartet: Moderner Arbeitsplatz in Berlin mit sehr guter Verkehrsanbindung Strukturierte Einarbeitung und ein kollegiales, wertschätzendes Team Digitale Prozesse, flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Raum zur persönlichen Entwicklung Klingt nach Ihrem neuen Job? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung! PRO RETURN PM GmbH Rankestraße 23 10789 Berlin Show more Show less

Title: Junior Office Manager
Description: Our Offer Takeover of own, varied projects and responsibilities from the beginning Prospects of being actively promoted and developed into an expert Team spirit and start-up atmosphere while working in a well-run organization Your work-life balance is important to us which is why flexible working hours and home office options are the norm for us and no exception Working at eye level with an experienced and interdisciplinary team Our onboarding program will help you get your bearings in the early days, and you will also have a personal buddy by your side Your Tasks Scheduling appointments (internal, client meetings, applicant interviews) Receipt and processing of incoming and outgoing mail Travel management including organizing and booking business trips Order management and preliminary accounting Professional customer reception and preparation of business meetings Planning and organizing internal and external events Supporting employees in all personnel matters Your Profile Commercial training or equivalent At least 1 year of professional experience in the secretarial/administrative field Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficient in common office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Confident and positive demeanor towards employees and customers Proficiency in German and very good English skills What will happen after you apply? You will receive an email confirming that we received your documents. Afterwards, our recruitment team will inform you if your experience matches our requirements. If yes, you will receive an invitation for an online interview. About Us Cocomore is not only a digital agency providing products and communication services for international clients like EssilorLuxottica, GroupeSEB, Nestlé, Procter & Gamble, or Samsung. Cocomore is also an incubator for digital start-ups, having so far sold to Deutsche Telekom, Axel Springer, and Pro7Sat1. Our team of 180 professionals is located across Europe, with a strong presence in Barcelona, Berlin, Frankfurt (headquarters), Hamburg, and Seville. And while we all have different skills and talents, we share a common spirit: we are human, entrepreneurial, and creative. This is our way of working together with colleagues, partners, and clients. You can find our statement on diversity, equality, and inclusiveness here: https://www.cocomore.com/diversity-statement. Show more Show less

Title: Rezeptionist:In
Description: IFA Fehmarn Hotel & Ferien-Centrum Auf Fehmarn arbeiten? Moin Arbeitsplatz direkt am Meer! 130 Mitarbeiter in der Saison. Wir suchen Unterstützung an der Rezeption, um unseren Gästen einen unvergesslichen Urlaub zu ermöglichen. Title: Office Manager
Description: I’m working with a leading global asset manager with a strong presence across the Americas, EMEA, and Asia-Pacific. Our firm is built on a culture of collaboration, integrity, and client focus. The Frankfurt office is home to a dedicated team of eight sales and client relationship professionals who serve a broad and sophisticated institutional and wholesale client base across Germany and the wider DACH region. Position Summary: We are seeking a proactive and highly organized Office Manager to oversee the smooth day-to-day operations of our Frankfurt office. The ideal candidate will be the heart of the office, ensuring a welcoming, professional, and efficient working environment. You will support both office administration and the local team’s operational needs, acting as a key liaison with global teams. Key Responsibilities: Manage the daily operations of the Frankfurt office, ensuring a well-functioning, professional, and client-ready environment Coordinate office maintenance, supplies, and equipment, ensuring cost-effective procurement and inventory management Provide administrative support to the local sales and relationship management team, including calendar coordination, travel booking, and expense reporting Support the onboarding process for new hires in coordination with HR and IT Organize internal meetings, client visits, and small-scale events, ensuring a high standard of hospitality Serve as a cultural ambassador and help foster a collaborative and inclusive office environment Assist with local budgeting and invoicing processes in collaboration with the finance department Coordinate communication and integration with global operational teams and corporate functions Key Requirements: 5+ years of experience in office management, administrative, or operations roles—preferably in financial services or professional services Fluent in German and English (spoken and written) Must have asset management experience Strong interpersonal and communication skills with a professional and service-oriented demeanour Highly organised, reliable, and able to multitask in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong Microsoft Office skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Experience working in a global or multicultural environment is a plus A proactive mindset with the ability to anticipate needs and take initiative Show more Show less

Title: Assistant Office Letting | Frankfurt Am Main

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: 🌱 100 % fossilfrei: Daran arbeiten wir seit 25 Jahren und treiben Projekte voran, die andere für undenkbar halten. Mit Wind, Sonne und grünem Wasserstoff erzeugen, speichern und liefern wir grüne Energie. Unsere über 1.200 Mitarbeitenden arbeiten an Energieprojekten mit einer Kapazität von mehr als 30 Gigawatt weltweit. ENERTRAG entwickelt, baut und betreibt Energielösungen aus Wind, Photovoltaik und grünem Wasserstoff, um die Energiewende weltweit voranzutreiben – und fossile Brennstoffe in der Energieversorgung vollständig zu ersetzen. 👉 Werde ein Teil vom ENERTRAG-Team an unserem Standort in Berlin als Executive Assistant (m/w/d) und lass uns gemeinsam die Energiewende voranbringen. Stellenbeschreibung Zentrale Anlaufstelle für die Kommunikation im Namen des Vorstandsmitglieds, inkl. Koordination und Beantwortung von E-Mails sowie Verfassen wichtiger Mitteilungen Aktive Mitgestaltung der internen Kommunikation und Sicherstellung eines reibungslosen Informationsflusses Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Vorstand und den Bereichsleitungen zur Optimierung der täglichen Abläufe Termin- und Veranstaltungsmanagement, inklusive Koordination von Meetings und Einhaltung von Fristen Organisation und Abwicklung von Geschäftsreisen sowie Reisekostenabrechnungen Unterstützung bei internen und externen Events, von Raumplanung bis Catering Verwaltung vertraulicher Informationen und Mitwirkung bei der Strukturierung von Arbeitsprozessen Projektarbeit in enger Abstimmung mit dem Vorstandsmitglied zur erfolgreichen Umsetzung Qualifikationen Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung, idealerweise als Executive Assistant (m/w/d) Ausgeprägtes Organisationstalent, Hands-On-Mentalität und Gestaltungswille Hohe Kommunikationsstärke und ausgeprägte Diskretion Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Idealerweise Kenntnisse in Polnisch und/oder Französisch Sicherer Umgang mit gängigen EDV-Tools, insbesondere Office 365 Zusätzliche Informationen 🏡 Flexibilität & Work-Life-Balance Urlaub : Nimm dir Zeit zum Abschalten - bei uns stehen dir 30 Tage Urlaub zur Verfügung. Workation : Du willst Reisen und Arbeiten verbinden? Bis zu 4 Wochen im Jahr kannst du aus dem EU-Ausland arbeiten. Flexibles Arbeiten : Büro oder Homeoffice? Je nach Tätigkeit entscheidest du gemeinsam mit uns, was am besten passt. 💰 Finanzen & Zukunft Betriebliche Altersvorsorge : Wir unterstützen dich dabei, heute schon für morgen vorzusorgen – mit Zuschüssen zur Altersvorsorge. KiTa-Zuschuss : Deine Familie ist uns wichtig: Wir beteiligen uns an den Kosten für die Kinderbetreuung. JobRad : Nachhaltig mobil: Nutze dein Dienstrad auch privat & umweltfreundlich. 📚 Weiterbildung & Entwicklung Weiterbildungsbudget : Ob fachlich oder persönlich – wir fördern deine Entwicklung mit einem großzügigen Budget. Sprachkurse : Verbessere dein Business-Englisch oder lerne eine neue Sprache - flexibel und praxisnah. 🏋️ Gesundheit & Teamspirit Fitnessangebote : Bleib fit mit unserer WellHub-Kooperation - Zugriff auf zahlreiche Fitnessstudios & Online-Angebote. Gesundheitsmanagement : Wir setzen auf Prävention: Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement und Unfallversicherung für alle. Teamevents : Ob Sommerfest, Teamworkshops oder kleine After-Work-Events - wir feiern Erfolge gemeinsam. 🌿 Company Benefits Erfolgsbonus : Als Anerkennung für Deinen Beitrag erhältst Du jährlich einen Bonus. Beteiligungsmöglichkeit : Werde Teil der Energiewende und profitiere von nachhaltigen Investitionen in Windkraftanlagen. Hast Du Fragen? Ich helfe dir gerne weiter: ruwanie.wijekoon@enertrag.com 🌍 Bei uns zählen Dein Können und Deine Motivation – nicht Alter, Behinderung, Geschlecht, Herkunft, Hautfarbe, sexuelle Orientierung oder Religion. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders – Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management – Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination – Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support – Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison – Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You’ll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less
