B. Bürokaufmann/-frau, Industriekaufmann/-frau oder vergleichbar) Unser Angebot an Sie: Flache Hierarchien und „Duz-Kultur“ Intensive Einarbeitung, auch in neue Aufgabengebiete 30 Tage Urlaub, 13 Gehälter Jobrad-Leasing Spend-It-Card für steuerfreie Sachzuwendungen Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager Frankfurt
Description: Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid. Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa. Job Description What is it all about? We are seeking an enthusiastic and highly organized Office Manager to join our team in Frankfurt! In this key role, you will support both our local team and the Regional Office Manager Central Europe in the smooth day-to-day running of our Frankfurt office. Your strong organizational and communication skills will be essential as you handle a variety of administrative tasks, manage onsite services, and ensure Health & Safety standards are met. As the first point of contact for colleagues, you will represent our company with professionalism, a friendly and positive attitude, and a well-presented manner. If you thrive in a dynamic office environment and enjoy supporting others, we’d love to hear from you! What we expect of you, day to day: Site Operations Manage onsite services (cleaning, catering, maintenance, office supplies) Space planning Site Security, Safety & Environment Health & Safety tasks (Visa + country-specific requirements) PO/invoice processes and local vendor relations VIP & Executive site visits Support onboarding and access for new joiners Oversee reception and visitor experience Stand-in receptionist Operations Monitor and maintain office supplies inventory Maintain a safe and secure working environment respecting all health & safety regulations (Visa rules and regulations, German labor law), implementing all required inspections, trainings and drills Effectively and successfully respond to problem situations Provide Reception support & management of legal documents Organise staff events Security and H&S: Guarantee a clean and safe office, liaising with contracted services and vendors, and ensuring that they comply with Visa standards (both Security and H&S) Be the point of contact for Security London and the Health & Safety Teams Respond to special incidents Dispose correctly of confidential waste Support the Crisis Management Team onsite Facilities: Manage relationships: vendors, service providers and landlord Manage Ask Corporate Services & Office Hub use and petitions Ensure application of OM Playbook Participate actively in any facilities renovations or expansions, as well as routine maintenance Maintain supply inventory Finance Prepare and fulfill OPEX budget Ensure correct utilization of purchase card (including expense reports), Purchase Orders & invoice support Provide strong support in audit processes Qualifications What we're after... Bachelor's Degree or diploma in business, management, finance or hospitality (nice to have) 5 or more years of admin and office management experience in very busy and international environment, covering regional activities, and regional offices experience in supporting large events, supporting facilities for other Offices/Hospitality/Executive Assistance Experience cooperating with the senior stakeholders. Great communication skills and working under the pressure English and German on Advanced level at least Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law. Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: Wir sind KASTNER, eine international tätige und inhabergeführte Werbeagentur. Wir sind die globale Lead Agency von Red Bull und haben viele weitere spannende Kunden wie Henkell Freixenet (Gorbatschow, Kuemmerling, Mangaroca Batida, Pott Rum), RECUP & REBOWL und viele mehr. KASTNER wurde 1982 gegründet und besteht aus gut 200 Mitarbeiter:innen in 8 verschiedenen Ländern (Europa und USA). Unser Büro in Offenbach am Main (Heyne Fabrik) ist mit über 60 Mitarbeiter:innen der größte Standort des Netzwerks. Wir bieten spannende Projekte, viel Verantwortung und ein familiäres, unterstützendes Umfeld und suchen Menschen mit Leidenschaft, Begeisterung und großem Einsatzwillen. Mindestens genauso wichtig ist uns aber eine eigene Haltung. Denn bei uns geht es nicht um Hierarchien, sondern vor allem um Deine Persönlichkeit. Fühlst du dich davon angesprochen? Dann bist du vielleicht genau der/die Richtige für die folgende Stelle. Office Manager (m/w/d) Vollzeit (40 Std./Woche), Beginn 15. Oktober 2025 oder früher Befristet bis 31.12.2026 (Vertretung wegen Elternzeit) Deine Aufgaben für den Standort Offenbach und Oberhofen (allesamt eigenverantwortlich, in enger Abstimmung mit der Geschäftsführung und der Finanzabteilung) Serviceorientierte und kompetente Betreuung des Empfangs Assistenz der Geschäftsführung und der Finanzabteilung Betreuung der Telefonzentrale Postbearbeitung und Kurierversand Reisemanagement (Flugbuchungen, Visa-Anträge, Mietwagen) samt Auslagen- und Reisekostenabrechnungen Einkauf und Verwaltung von Büromitteln und Verbrauchsgütern Vorbereitung von Meetings inklusive Kundenempfang Vorbereitende Buchhaltung (Erfassung von Eingangsrechnungen, Kassenverwaltung, Kreditkartenabrechnung) Pflege und Erfassung von Stammdaten in der Agentur-Software Verwaltung von Urlaubsanträgen und Krankmeldungen Eigenständige Korrespondenz mit Lieferanten und Kunden Koordination des Terminkalenders Kommunikation mit der externen IT, Bearbeitung On- und Offboardings sowie Verwaltung von Leasingverträgen Passwortverwaltung Pflege der Plattform Notion intern Was Dich qualifiziert Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung Erste Berufserfahrung in einer Assistenzfunktion von Vorteil Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten Routinierter Umgang mit den MS-Office-Anwendungen Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (idealerweise auch gute Englischkenntnisse) Selbstsicheres, serviceorientiertes Auftreten Deutliche und verbindliche schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikationsfähigkeit Ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit Proaktive Arbeitsweise Gewissenhaftigkeit und Verantwortungsbewusstsein Zuverlässigkeit, Verbindlichkeit und Pflichtbewusstsein, Spaß an Organisation Sinn für Humor Was wir bieten Eine tolle Arbeitsatmosphäre in der historischen Heyne Fabrik Ein sehr erfahrenes, stetig wachsendes Team Ein familiäres Miteinander mit flachen Hierarchien Einen Mac für die Arbeit und ein iPhone – auch zum privaten Gebrauch Wenn Du Dich in diesen Aufgaben und Anforderungen wiederfindest und Lust auf eine neue Herausforderung hast, dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung. Sende Deine vollständigen Unterlagen inklusive Anschreiben und Lebenslauf einfach an: sebastian.albert@kastner.agency Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: 🚀 EU Office Manager 🚀 📍 Location: 10783, Berlin 💖 Department: People & Workplace 📅 Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you’ll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied 🌍 Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. 💡 Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. 🔎 Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. 🌱 Agents of Change: You’ll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. 🌟 Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. 🚀 Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you’ll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you’ve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you’re already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You’ll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us—with the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - €150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; €150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir ab sofort Mitarbeiter (gn) Officemanagement ​ Leipzig ​ befristet (2 Jahre) ​ Vollzeit Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir eine engagierte Persönlichkeit mit einem ausgeprägten Organisationstalent und einem souveränen Auftreten. Als Office Manager (gn) übernimmst Du eine zentrale Rolle im täglichen Ablauf der e2m trägst mit Deinem strukturierten Arbeitsstil und Deinem Verantwortungsbewusstsein maßgeblich zur positiven Arbeitsatmosphäre und zum professionellen Außenauftritt bei. Das erwartet Dich Verantwortung des gesamten Officemanagements und somit Sicherstellung eines professionellen und effizienten Bürobetriebs. Steuerung von externen Dienstleistern, wie Hausverwaltung, Reinigungskräfte und weiteren Partnern. Übernahme der Koordination, Organisation und Betreuung von Meetings mit internen und externen Teilnehmenden, nach den Anforderungen der Fachbereiche - Von der Raumkoordination bis zur Durchführung. Bearbeitung der Ein- und Ausgangspost sowie Überwachung aller relevanten Versand- und Empfangsprozesse. Verantwortung für die Beschaffung von Büromaterial bzw. Einkäufen aus dem Verantwortungsbereich bis hin zu Anfragen aus den Fachbereichen. Aktive Unterstützung im Event- und Reisemanagement. Repräsentation des Unternehmens am Empfang, als erste Ansprechperson für externe Gäste und Mitarbeitende. Das bringst Du mit Erfolgreich abgeschlossene kaufmännische Berufsausbildung im Bereich Büromanagement oder Hotelfach oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation (Quereinstieg möglich) . Strukturierte, ergebnisorientierte und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise sowie ein ausgeprägtes Kunden- und Dienstleistungsverständnis. Hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz sowie ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Organisationsfähigkeiten. Sicherer Umgang mit MS-Office. Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift. Was wir Dir bieten Moderne Arbeitswelt mit abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben im Bereich der erneuerbaren Energien. Attraktives Benefitspaket mit Jobbike oder Jobticket, Kitazuschuss und steuerfreiem Sachbezug (50 €/Monat). Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld. Eine Wochenarbeitszeit von Montag - Freitag (kein Wochenenddienst). Kostenlose Getränke und Obstkörbe, sowie Teamevents. Kostenlose Nutzung des Sprachenlernsystems Babbel. Moderne Ausstattung mit qualitativ hochwertiger Hardware in Plagwitz. Show more Show less

Title: Office-Manager
Description: Ihre Aufgaben Kompetente/r Ansprechpartner*in sowohl für unsere Mandanten, Assessment-Teilnehmer als auch für Kollegen*innen Professionelle Unterstützung/Entlastung der Partner & Berater in allen organisatorischen und administrativen Belangen Erstellen von Präsentationen (Angebote, Projektvorstellungen, Dokumente für Mandanten) Assessments: Koordination der Vor- und Nachbereitung von Assessments, Einladungskoordination, Betreuung und Bewirtung von Assessment-Teilnehmern (Geschäftspartnern, Mandanten), Erstellen von Berichtsvorlagen für die Berater, Korrekturlesen der Berichte und anderer Dokumente Termin- und Wiedervorlage-Management sowie Auftrags- und Rechnungswesen Vor- und Nachbereitung von Meetings, Video- und Telefonkonferenzen Pflege und Aktualisierung der Datenbank Ihr Profil Ausbildung : Kauffrau/-mann für Bürokommunikation oder ähnliche kaufmännische Ausbildung oder Studium Berufserfahrung : Mind. 5 Jahren Berufserfahrung nachweisbar in einer vergleichbaren Position Sprachkenntnisse : Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift IT-Kenntnisse: Hervorragende Office-Kenntnisse (Power Point, Word, Excel, Outlook), Datenbank Wir erwarten: Sehr hohes Engagement und Einsatzbereitschaft, Flexibilität, zügige, selbstständige Arbeitsweise, top Zuverlässigkeit, sehr sorgfältiges Arbeiten erwünscht, gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten nach außen als auch intern, hohe Kundenorientierung, Dienstleistungsbereitschaft (ein Auge für das Detail), Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Teamgeist Sonstiges : Stressresistent, strahlt Ruhe aus und behält kompetent den Überblick, erkennt Zusammenhänge und agiert der Situation angemessen Bitte senden Sie Ihre aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen per E-Mail an Ina Raab (ina.raab@sourisseauxpartners.de). Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager (Part Time) – Workplace & Office Operations
Description: Your role As our Office Manager , your role goes beyond creating a pleasant atmosphere – you're responsible for building and maintaining the foundation of a well-structured, safe, and smoothly functioning office workspace and infrastructure. With a solution-oriented and hands-on mindset, you take ownership of the spaces, routines, and resources that keep our daily office life running. Infuse positive energy into the work environment, putting smiles on the faces of employees, applicants, suppliers, and visitors You will take full ownership of our office infrastructure for more than 250 people – this includes planning and organizing the office layout, coordinating furniture needs, and ensuring a functional, well-designed workspace You'll also manage security and access control, making sure everyone can work safely and efficiently Regular facility checks and ensuring safety compliance are also part of your weekly routine Coordinate and manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure a seamless day-to-day office operation Collaborate closely with our Office Management team of three to continuously improve our office workflows, support internal teams, and foster a culture of sustainability and operational excellence Your profile Ideally, you have professional experience in Administration, Office Management, Reception & Front Desk, Business Operations, or Operations Management You should have experience working in large office spaces and managing their operations – know-how in office expansions or multi-site operations is a big plus! Ideally, you also bring knowledge in office safety & security management, office space and furniture planning, and facility maintenance, and understand their importance for operational efficiency and the overall employee experience You embody an open, helpful nature, combined with an independent working style and a strong desire to take ownership of your projects You have very good communication skills in both English and German, and you're available for 32 hours per week starting from November What we offer An appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation' We offer German and English language courses – financed entirely by us! Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Contact Sabrina Thome Apply for this job About Us Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy – as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations. We take our ecological responsibility very seriously : Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable. We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues. We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements. Show more Show less

Title: Probationary Officer
Description: This Job Is Provided By Apna.co JOB DISCRIPTION Probationary Officer (MBA Required) - High Financial Branches (Muthoot) Position Title: Probationary Officer Location: High Financial Branches (Across Designated Locations) Salary: 2,67LPA Upto ₹3,10,000 per annum + Performance-based Variables & Incentives Growth Opportunity: Fast-Track Promotion to Assistant Manager About Muthoot: Muthoot Group is one of the most trusted and established names in the financial services sector, offering a wide range of products including gold loans, personal loans, insurance, and wealth management services. We are committed to delivering customer satisfaction, fostering innovation, and offering exceptional growth opportunities to our employees. Position Overview: We are seeking dynamic, results-driven individuals with an MBA (minimum 50%) to join our team as Probationary Officers in our high financial branches. This role is designed to give you exposure to branch management, customer relationship handling, and revenue generation, while offering the potential for fast-track career advancement, with promotion opportunities to Assistant Manager based on performance. Key Responsibilities Branch Operations Management: Oversee and ensure smooth operations at high-performing branches, maintaining compliance with internal policies and regulatory standards. Customer Relationship Management: Build and nurture relationships with existing and new customers, offering tailored financial solutions to meet their needs. Sales & Business Development: Canvassing and sourcing of New Customers to increase Gold loan Business,Drive business generation by actively promoting and selling Muthoot’s financial products and services. Meet and exceed sales targets. Financial Performance Monitoring: Revenue generations through Cross Selling products & Interest Collection Work towards enhancing branch financial performance, improving sales, and implementing strategies to achieve business goals. Team Coordination: Lead and work collaboratively with branch staff, ensuring optimal productivity, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure that all operations adhere to legal, regulatory, and company standards. Identify and manage operational risks effectively. Qualifications & Skills Educational Qualification: MBA (with at least 60% marks) MCOM (with at least 70% marks) Experience: Fresh MBA graduates or candidates with up to 2 years of relevant work experience in banking, finance, or related sectors. Skills: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Knowledge of banking operations, financial products, and services. Good analytical and problem solving abilities. Target-driven and results-oriented approach. Proficiency in MS Office and other financial tools/software. What We Offer: Salary: ₹ 2,67,000 UPTO ₹3,10,000 per annum with additional performance-based variables and incentives. Career Growth: Fast-track promotion to Assistant Manager based on performance and branch success. Training & Development: Extensive training to develop your skills and knowledge for rapid career advancement. Work Environment: A vibrant and collaborative work culture that fosters learning and growth. Interested candidate can send their udated Resume TO Regional Hr KIRAN KUMAR 8074611369 or Mail recruitncni@muthootgroup.com or Walkin & walk out with offer letter on below Addres: Muthoot Finance Ltd.Regional office RV Tower, No:77 / 1 Habibullah Road, T-Nagar Chennai - 600017. VACANCY LOCATIONS:CHENNAI - VIVEKANANDA NAGAR CHENNAI - GOVARDHANAGIRI CHENNAI - MKB NAGAR CHENNAI - AVADI - CTH ROAD CHENNAI-KOLATHUR CHENNAI - MADHAVARAM BAZAR STREET GUMMIDIPOONDI - (TN) UTHUKOTTAI CHENNAI - AYAPPAKKAM CHENNAI - AMBATTUR, VARADARAJAPURAM CHENNAI - THIRUMULLAIVAYAL ARAMBAKKAM PONNERI CHENNAI - KARAYANCHAVADI CHENNAI - VIRUGAMBAKKAM CHENNAI - MOULIVAKKAM THAMARAIPAKKAM CHENNAI - IYYAPPANTHANGAL PONNERI - TALUK OFFICE ROAD PERIYAPALAYAM - TN CHENNAI - VANIANCHATRAM MINJUR (TN) Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Leading Private Equity Firm – central Frankfurt location Competitive salary and package The Client: One of Europe’s leading private equity firms is seeking a proactive and motivated Assistant to join their busy Frankfurt office. You will be working alongside a diverse team, in a vital role which will be to support their Investment Professionals. The Role: Maintain the appearance of the office, creating a welcoming environment for guests and colleagues Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, assisting with meeting preparations Managing administrative tasks Collaborate with IT department for seamless technological operations Liaise with vendors and service providers to maintain office functionality Complex calendar / diary management International travel arrangement planning often across time zones Processing expenses Regular liaison and interaction with global offices Provide support during local events as required The Candidate: Fluent in both written and spoken German, and English Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask Proactive decision-making and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment Attention to detail and commitment to excellence Effective communication skills and willingness to learn Positive attitude and enthusiasm for teamwork Have a professional, committed attitude and approach Ideally come from an international financial or professional services environment in which you have needed to use initiative and be a self-starter The Package: Competitive Salary Performance-based bonus 1 day working from home office 25 days annual leave Supportive work hours with flexibility for meetings Wellness perks including complimentary snacks and massages Opportunities for professional development and team-building events If you have relevant industry experience working in a similar role and are looking for your next career move, please apply today! Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant Global Investment Bank Munich, Bavaria We have just picked up a fantastic opportunity to join a global investment bank in Munich! This role is a Team Assistant position joining the firm and another assistant to not support a managing director, but also take on some light office management duties. The team in Munich is absolutely incredible and they also love to get together for social and sporting events to keep the team spirit alive! The culture in this office is unmatched and perfect for someone who is keen to roll up their sleeves, bring energy and positive attitude to the office. German and English are essential in this role as you will be working closely together with other assistants across different offices. You will also get 1 day working from home and a incredible team of colleagues where you will be valued for your contribution! MAIN DUTIES: Assistant – direct support to the Managing Partners & some more junior Investment Professionals based in Munich (full diary management, travel arrangements, secretarial & organisational support) Office Management – overall responsibility for leading the office & ensuring the wider team is supported well and office is running smoothly. Projects – assistance with events & process implementation This is a perfect role to take the next step in your career. The team are very welcoming and supportive, and would like to find a candidate the fits well within their culture. Being well organised with strong communication skills are key. Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders – Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management – Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination – Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support – Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison – Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You’ll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant - stunning, centrally located Frankfurt office! THE CLIENT Our client is a successful, independent investment firm operating across Europe. With a modern, centrally located office in Frankfurt, they operate with a collaborative tight-knit, high-performing team. As the firm continues to grow, they are looking for a reliable and proactive Team Assistant & Receptionist to provide full operational and front-office support to their Frankfurt team. THE ROLE Working alongside a wonderfully supportive Office Manager, the role will be hands-on and varied ideal for someone with a collaborative mindset. As the Team Assistant & Receptionist, you’ll play a pivotal role in keeping the office running smoothly, managing travel, events, and day-to-day coordination. You’ll be the face of the office and a vital support to the wider team — it’s a great opportunity for someone who enjoys being a 'go to' person. Duties will include but are not limited to: Managing and coordinating calendars and travel (national and international) Booking and supporting meetings, video calls, and conference calls Processing expenses for the Frankfurt team Organising team events (e.g. off-sites, team days) Preparing and formatting documents and presentations (Word and PowerPoint) in both German and English Welcoming guests, setting up meeting rooms, and arranging catering Maintaining a presentable reception, kitchen, and communal area Handling daily post, filing, and general office admin Ordering supplies and managing stock inventory Covering for colleagues during holidays Reproducing and binding documents and presentation packs KEY REQUIREMENTS 3+ years’ experience in a similar Team Assistant/Administrative role Fluent in German and English, both spoken and written Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel Excellent organisational and multitasking skills Friendly, dependable, and highly professional Strong attention to detail and the ability to follow procedures Proactive and enthusiastic with a “can-do” attitude Confident communicator, able to liaise comfortably with internal and external stakeholders Experience working across multiple teams BENEFITS Hugely competitive salary and bonus potential, plus benefits including: • Annual discretionary bonus • 30 days’ holiday • Job Ticket • Gym Membership • Bright, modern office in Frankfurt’s city centre • Flat hierarchy and agile working style • A positive team culture that encourages personal ownership and initiative Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Über uns: SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung – wir sind Ihr Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung. Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Sie lieben es, einem Team den Rücken frei zu halten, es zu entlasten und somit am Projekterfolg teilzuhaben? Dann suchen wir SIE! Im Auftrag eines renommierten Private Equity Unternehmens im Herzen Münchens, suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in unbefristeter Festanstellung (in Direktvermittlung, keine Arbeitnehmerüberlassung) eine/n Team Assistant (m/w/d) Ihr zukünftiges Unternehmen im Überblick: München: Unser Kunde zählt zu den weltweit führenden Private Equity Unternehmen mit Sitz im Herzen Münchens / Nähe Odeonsplatz. Verantwortungsbereich: Als Team Assistant (m/w/d) übernehmen Sie die Betreuung und Entlastung ihres Teams sowie die internationale Korrespondenz und sind erster Ansprechpartner intern sowie extern. Die Sicherstellung eines reibungslosen Informationsflusses zwischen internen Fachbereichen und externen Schnittstellen wie Kunden, Lieferanten, Dienstleistern liegt in Ihren Händen. Sie erledigen anspruchsvolle administrative Aufgaben wie Rechnungsstellung, Reisekostenabrechnung, die Koordination der Kalender (Termin- und Reiseplanung) und sorgen dabei für einen effizienten Ablauf aller Termine. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Responsibilities: The Executive Assistant (EA) provides project and business administration support to the search team in all aspects of the search process including: document preparation and management, scheduling and planning of candidate and client interviews and meetings, accounts receivable and accounts payable, expense reporting, correspondence and file management. An integral part of an EA’s role is problem solving within the search execution and administrative process. Specific Responsibilities: Responsible for the administration of the search process for all team search assignments Formatting, editing, proofreading, preparing and transmitting client deliverables Maintaining consultant calendar Preparing travel itineraries for the consultant, client or candidate in any part of the search process Supporting search team with account management and client relationship, including consultant expenses, client invoices/receivables and other financial reports Creating and maintaining an efficient file management and follow-up system for all search processes Maintaining client and candidate communications through scheduling and prioritizing telephone and email communication Verifying degrees of candidates Consistently building strong relationships and good rapport with candidates and clients Maintaining the accuracy, quality and integrity of all search information in the Heidrick & Struggles database Maintaining and developing job-related skills by attending Company learning programs and keeping up-to-date with job/industry-related reading Maintaining client, candidate and companywide confidentiality Contributing to the team and office by providing reception relief and back-up assistance to other EAs May assist with database research and coding of records in collaboration with Associate or Research Associate practice resources Qualifications: High school education required; college degree desired At least five years of administrative experience in roles requiring strong project coordination Demonstrate a business acumen and financial awareness Proficient knowledge of all Microsoft Office products. Minimum keyboarding skills of 60wpm. Experience with proprietary database environments, a plus Excellent communication skills—verbal, written and listening Experience dealing with people at all levels of an organization, getting and giving often complex and sensitive information in both verbal and written communications Professional services experience, a plus Fluency in both German and English Behavioral Competencies: External and internal awareness: Maintains personal contacts across the internal organization and appropriately shares information. Addresses business process issues proactively with other areas, as necessary Analytical Thinking: Develops frameworks to assure that “pros” and “cons” are evaluated, key issues are identified and detailed analysis is synthesized Creative Thinking: Sets a personal example of seeking out new and better ways of doing things Stays open to new ideas and approaches Generates new ideas Client orientation: Constantly hones understanding and responsiveness to internal and external client requirements, goals and issues Self-confidence and determination Manages most situations in a calm, steady, “can-do” manner Demonstrates self-confidence; resilient Demonstrates a focus on results over time; resourceful, tenacious Relationship building Takes the time to maintain relationships and create new ones Driving results: Manages projects, activities and resources according to search and team strategy effectively Sets priorities and reviews progress against goals regularly Multitasks effectively and efficiently Best practice perspective: Seeks to adopt best practices to increase effectiveness and organization competitiveness Eager to participate in the coaching and mentoring of new employees through formal and informal learning programs and relationships Possesses strong personal commitment to quality standards and meeting quality expectations Gives constructive feedback and recommends suggestions for improvement, where appropriate Organizational buy-in: Generates enthusiasm for Company strategies and key initiatives Energizes others with whom he/she is in regular contact Personal Characteristics Available to work Monday through Friday during normal office hours Demonstrates strong business ethics (honesty, integrity, confidentiality, discretion) in all situations Strong team player Maintains composure in fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Displays appropriate sense of humor in the workplace Flexible to work overtime, when needed Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Als Executive Assistant (m/w/d) unterstützen Sie zwei Geschäftsleitungen in einer Firmengruppe in organisatorischen, administrativen und operativen Belangen. Mit Ihrem strukturierten Arbeitsstil und Ihrer hohen Kommunikationsfähigkeit sorgen Sie für einen reibungslosen Ablauf im Tagesgeschäft, behalten auch in anspruchsvollen Situationen den Überblick und halten somit der Geschäftsführung den Rücken frei. Kernaufgaben Organisation, Koordination und Protokollierung von internen und externen Besprechungen, Sitzungen und Konferenzen Unterstützung bei der Erstellung und Aufbereitung von Präsentationen, Vorträgen und Reden Verantwortung für die Terminplanung sowie Koordination und Nachverfolgung organisatorischer Aufgaben Planung, Buchung und Vorbereitung von Geschäftsreisen , einschließlich Reisekostenabrechnungen und Nachbereitung Administrative Unterstützung , insbesondere bei der Pflege und Organisation des Dokumentenmanagementsystems (DMS), sowie unterstützender Tätigkeiten im Bereich buchhaltungsnaher Prozesse. Kommunikation mit und Betreuung von Kunden, Geschäftspartnern und internen Schnittstellen Flexible Unterstützung in jeglichen ad-hoc Themen und Aufgaben Direkter Ansprechpartner für die Geschäftsführung der operativen Gesellschaft, sowie für die Geschäftsführung des Investmentarms Profil Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder vergleichbare Qualifikation Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Assistenz- oder Office-Management-Position Ausgezeichnete organisatorische Fähigkeiten und eine strukturierte, proaktive Arbeitsweise Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office (insbesondere PowerPoint, Word und Outlook) Hohe Diskretion, Zuverlässigkeit und Teamfähigkeit Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Sie sind gerne im Büro und können sich auf eine Wochenarbeitszeit von mindestens 30 Stunden festlegen Kandidaten mit sofortiger Verfügbarkeit werden bevorzugt Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: One of Hauser Recruiting's new clients - a European investment firm - has recently opened their new modern office in prime location in Frankfurt and they seek their first Executive Assistant / Office Manager. Fluency in German and advanced English language skills are essential! This is an established firm with offices throughout Europe, and a start-up feel in Frankfurt. This will suit you if you are an Executive Assistant or Team Assistant, able & happy to work as the team's sole support, with a view to establishing structure. You will work closely with other European business support colleagues, manage the Frankfurt office, and set the standards for future members of the business support team. You should enjoy working in an environment that changes constantly, and no two days will be the same! You should be happy supporting the whole team. My client has plans to double the number of employees in the next year - an exciting time to join in this period of company growth! Because you are responsible for the office as well as providing EA support, this role is office-based 5 days per week. This could be more flexible when the business support team grows. If this is an opportunity that suits your career motivators, what skills should you bring to be considered for the role? Proven history in a European or global financial services / investment business Experience as a Team Assistant or Executive Assistant with diverse duties including diary management, travel organisation, expenses, administration & some office management tasks Advanced, confident communication skills in English & fluency in German - essential Well-structured and independent working style Proactive support, taking on small and large tasks without differentiation Ability to multi-task Ideally some experience of organising team events If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Title: Executive Assistant
Description: A rare opportunity for an Assistant seeking a varied and dynamic role in Frankfurt's Bankenviertel! It can't be overstated that every day working for this boutique investment firm will be different... This will suit you if you enjoy working in an everchanging environment, adapting to shifting priorities and have the ability to think outside the box. You must have fluent German & advanced English language skills. You'll work alongside the Office Manager / Senior Executive Assistant who is an expert in her field, with more than 20 years supporting at the most senior level, and she is keen to share information, help you to upskill and support your career development. She has a wonderful balance of professionalism and fun - and she's looking for a great teammate! In return, you'll be rewarded with a highly competitive salary, target-driven bonuses, career development and a role that will allow you to add real value. You will enjoy this role if you like working in a smaller (yet very chic!) office environment. This will be office-based 5 days per week during Probezeit, with home office opportunity upon successful completion. The Role You will support the Managing Director, and work very closely with the Senior Executive Assistant / Office Manager to support with office and project management. Core duties include: Calendar coordination & inbox management Travel arrangements Organisation of meetings Preparation of presentations Handling sensitive legal, financial & personnel documentation Expenses, invoicing Arranging events Ad-hoc projects Ensuring the smooth running of the office alongside the Office Manager Covering for the Office Manager when she is away To be considered for this role, these are essential skills and attributes: Demonstrate experience in high-level service-oriented environments (such as completed your Hotelfachfrau/mann Ausbildung in 5* hotels), or worked as an Assistant in a similar boutique environment Demonstrate previous experience working with high-net-worth individuals / senior executives Possess fluent German and advanced English skills Comprehensive MS Office knowledge Excellent organisational and administrative skills Enjoy and work well in an ever-changing environment with moving deadlines Ability to problem-solve and use initiative Possess a professional and calm demeanour Impeccable attention to detail Exercise discretion and confidentiality If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Title: Rezeptionist:In
Description: Über Hogan Lovells Hogan Lovells ist eine der führenden internationalen Anwalts­sozietäten mit mehr als 50 Büros weltweit. In Deutschland sind wir mit Büros in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg und München vertreten. Unsere Mandanten unterstützen wir mit verständlicher, praxis­orientierter und genau auf sie zugeschnittener Rechts­beratung – für alle Fragestellungen. Wir stehen nicht nur für Rechts­beratung auf höchstem Niveau und spannende internationale Mandate, sondern auch für Inclusion, soziales Engagement und eine freundliche Atmosphäre. Wir suchen Mitarbeitende, die nicht nur exzellente Erfahrungen mitbringen, sondern auch persönlich zu uns passen. Zur Verstärkung unseres Rezeptions-Teams suchen wir am Standort Düsseldorf zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n Empfangs­mitarbeiter*in / Rezeptionist (w/m/d) Front Office & Konferenz­bereich Vollzeit / unbefristet / 40 Wochenstunden Die Arbeitszeiten gestalten sich flexibel täglich (Montag-Freitag) zwischen 8:00 Uhr und 20:00 Uhr. Das sympathische und hochmotivierte Team freut sich auf Sie und sorgt für Ihre strukturierte Einarbeitung. Diese spannenden Aufgaben warten auf Sie: Herzlicher und freundlicher Empfang unserer Gäste Eigenverantwortliche Betreuung des gesamten Konferenzzentrums (Backoffice, Frontoffice, Konferenzservice) Sorgfältige Planung und Organisation der Bewirtung unserer Gäste, inklusive der Einholung von Angeboten und der reibungslosen Koordination des Caterings vor Ort Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Events-Team innerhalb der Betreuung von Veranstaltungen Entgegennahme, Weiterleitung und Bearbeitung von Telefonaten in deutscher und englischer Sprache Gewissenhafte Bearbeitung der Ein- und Ausgangspost Selbstständige Erledigung allgemeiner administrativer Aufgaben Diese Qualitäten bringen Sie mit: Abgeschlossene Ausbildung (z. B. im Hotelfach, kaufmännischer Bereich oder Gastronomie) Erste Erfahrungen an der Rezeption wären wünschenswert Ausgeprägtes Organisationstalent, präzise Arbeitsweise sowie Hands-on-Mentalität und professionelles Dienstleistungs­verständnis Lust auf engagiertes Teamwork Sehr gute Umgangsformen; sicheres, freundliches und offenes Auftreten Diskretion und Loyalität Gute, anwendbare MS-Office-Kenntnisse In der Praxis erprobte, sehr gute Deutsch- und Englisch­kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Das können Sie von uns erwarten: Abwechslungsreiche und anspruchs­volle Tätigkeiten nach strukturierter Einarbeitung in kollegialen und hochmotivierten Teams Moderner Arbeitsplatz mit sehr guter öffentlicher Anbindung Dynamische, innovative und respektvolle Unternehmenskultur Zuschuss Vermögenswirksame Leistungen Finanzielle Beteiligung am Mittagessen Urban Sports Club Branchenübliche Vergütung, 30 Tage Jahresurlaub, Jobticket, Corporate Benefits sowie viele Events für die Mitarbeitenden und Wellbeing-Angebote Soziales Engagement (Responsible Business-Programme) Wir sind stolz auf unsere wertschätzende Kultur und die Vielfalt in unserer Kanzlei. Wir begrüßen alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung/Identität. Wichtige Informationen zu Ihrer Bewerbung: Gehen Sie den nächsten Schritt – wir freuen uns auf Sie! Bitte übersenden Sie uns Ihre voll­ständigen Unterlagen (Lebenslauf, Abschluss- und Arbeits­zeugnisse) nebst Angabe Ihres Gehalts­rahmen­wunsches und sonstiger für uns wichtiger Infor­mationen (z. B. Kündi­gungsfrist, Eintritts­termin) direkt über unser Online-Portal. Bei Rückfragen zu dieser Position oder zu unserem Angebot stehen wir Ihnen jederzeit gerne persönlich zur Verfügung. Hogan Lovells International LLP Elisabeth Schütz Recruitment Advisor München muenchen.bewerbung@hoganlovells.com www.hoganlovells.de Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Join our dynamic team in Munich as an Executive Assistant. MERMEC Deutschland is a dynamic and growing company in the rail sector. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and enjoy a variety of responsibilities, in a business unit in growth. We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to provide direct support to our executive management team, particularly the CEO. This role involves a mix of administrative, organizational, and communication responsibilities, requiring strong multitasking skills and discretion. Responsibilities: Provide high-level administrative support to the CEO and executive team Manage calendars, coordinate appointments, and schedule meetings Organize and book business travel (individual and group) Prepare meeting materials, presentations, and internal reports Follow up on meeting action points and deadlines Plan and support internal and external events Handle incoming calls and emails on behalf of the executives Liaise with internal departments and external partners as needed Qualifications: Completed commercial training or similar qualification Experience in executive assistance is an advantage Strong organizational and time-management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities High discretion and sense of responsibility Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Fluent in German and English (written and spoken) Ability to work independently, flexibly, and reliably We are looking forward for you application!
