Title: Executive Assistant
Description: One of Hauser Recruiting's new clients - a European investment firm - has recently opened their new modern office in prime location in Frankfurt and they seek their first Executive Assistant / Office Manager. Fluency in German and advanced English language skills are essential! This is an established firm with offices throughout Europe, and a start-up feel in Frankfurt. This will suit you if you are an Executive Assistant or Team Assistant, able & happy to work as the team's sole support, with a view to establishing structure. You will work closely with other European business support colleagues, manage the Frankfurt office, and set the standards for future members of the business support team. You should enjoy working in an environment that changes constantly, and no two days will be the same! You should be happy supporting the whole team. My client has plans to double the number of employees in the next year - an exciting time to join in this period of company growth! Because you are responsible for the office as well as providing EA support, this role is office-based 5 days per week. This could be more flexible when the business support team grows. If this is an opportunity that suits your career motivators, what skills should you bring to be considered for the role? Proven history in a European or global financial services / investment business Experience as a Team Assistant or Executive Assistant with diverse duties including diary management, travel organisation, expenses, administration & some office management tasks Advanced, confident communication skills in English & fluency in German - essential Well-structured and independent working style Proactive support, taking on small and large tasks without differentiation Ability to multi-task Ideally some experience of organising team events If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders – Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management – Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination – Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support – Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison – Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You’ll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant - Corporate & Administrative Services
Description: Overview LabConnect improves lives by partnering with pharmaceutical and biotech companies, and clinical research organizations (CROs) to accelerate the development of new medicines around the world. We are an independent, global, one-stop-shop focused on delivering Central Laboratory Services that are tailor-made, timely and flexible to meet the evolving study demands of traditional to increasingly complex trials. Additionally, we provide Functional Service Provider (FSP) Solutions, supporting our clients with scientific and technical expertise, acting as an extension of their team, coordinating all laboratory related needs, advising on strategies for lab data collection and providing end-to-end analytical and logistical solutions. Summary LabConnect EMEA is seeking to hire an organized, motivated and detail-oriented multi-tasker to join our team. You will provide high-level administrative support to the Executive Team, create and manage the operational dashboard and is responsible for several projects within EMEA. You will be working on-site in one of our locations. Duties and Responsibilities Support Executive Director, Global Bio Operations Serve as key liaison between Executive Director, Global Bio Operations and key internal and external partners, clients, institutions, and other stakeholders, providing excellent customer service. Responsible for calendar management, including planning meetings, taking notes, and overseeing the execution of open actions. Coordinate recurring check-ins and communicate with multiple parties to schedule events. Provide high-level operational and administrative support. Complete expense reports, reimbursements, and travel arrangements. Assist in the management of organizational budgets, tracking metrics, and creating dashboards for EMEA operations using SharePoint and Power BI. Manage additional projects for the EMEA region and global initiatives. Organize all meeting logistics: booking meetings, locations, and caterers. Maintain and distribute related documents, e.g., manuals, minutes, rosters, etc. Record minutes during meetings and distribute to members post-meetings. Project Management and Metrics Tracking Lead EMEA and global project management efforts, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Track key metrics and create dashboards in SharePoint to visualize data and support decision-making. Utilize Power BI to analyze data and generate insights for continuous improvement. Additional Information Education, Qualifications And Requirements Equivalent to graduation from a four-year college. Additional professional or administrative experience may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis. A minimum of two years of experience in a comparable role. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially within Excel and Power-BI. Proven track record of excellent follow-through and accountability. Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and execute multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with creating dashboards and project management. Ability to work independently. Willing to travel and work on both location in Swalmen and Cologne. Self-starter with a positive, can-do attitude. Flexible and able to meet changing work needs and demands. Being proactive and anticipating future needs Strong writing, proofreading and verbal communication skills. Excellent time management skills. Language Ability Fluent in English and preferably in Dutch and/or German Read more below and get ready for your next great employment adventure! Some of the Perks our LabConnectors Love: We truly live our values: People First, Quality Focused, Customer Centered, Technology Driven and Accountability Always. The ability to make an impact on a passionate and growing team Great communication on a smaller sized team A market based salary Tools to effectively do your job (laptop, phone reimbursement) In addition to great perks and challenging work assignments, we invest in our people with enriching career growth opportunities. We believe in a friendly and collaborative environment with open lines of communication. Join our team and discover how your work can impact the lives of people all over the world. It is the policy of LabConnect to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law. Equal Employment Opportunity Posters: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters If you have a disability and you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please email talent@labconnect.com or call +1(423)722-3155. For more information, visit www.labconnect.com Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Responsibilities: The Executive Assistant (EA) provides project and business administration support to the search team in all aspects of the search process including: document preparation and management, scheduling and planning of candidate and client interviews and meetings, accounts receivable and accounts payable, expense reporting, correspondence and file management. An integral part of an EA’s role is problem solving within the search execution and administrative process. Specific Responsibilities: Responsible for the administration of the search process for all team search assignments Formatting, editing, proofreading, preparing and transmitting client deliverables Maintaining consultant calendar Preparing travel itineraries for the consultant, client or candidate in any part of the search process Supporting search team with account management and client relationship, including consultant expenses, client invoices/receivables and other financial reports Creating and maintaining an efficient file management and follow-up system for all search processes Maintaining client and candidate communications through scheduling and prioritizing telephone and email communication Verifying degrees of candidates Consistently building strong relationships and good rapport with candidates and clients Maintaining the accuracy, quality and integrity of all search information in the Heidrick & Struggles database Maintaining and developing job-related skills by attending Company learning programs and keeping up-to-date with job/industry-related reading Maintaining client, candidate and companywide confidentiality Contributing to the team and office by providing reception relief and back-up assistance to other EAs May assist with database research and coding of records in collaboration with Associate or Research Associate practice resources Qualifications: High school education required; college degree desired At least five years of administrative experience in roles requiring strong project coordination Demonstrate a business acumen and financial awareness Proficient knowledge of all Microsoft Office products. Minimum keyboarding skills of 60wpm. Experience with proprietary database environments, a plus Excellent communication skills—verbal, written and listening Experience dealing with people at all levels of an organization, getting and giving often complex and sensitive information in both verbal and written communications Professional services experience, a plus Fluency in both German and English Behavioral Competencies: External and internal awareness: Maintains personal contacts across the internal organization and appropriately shares information. Addresses business process issues proactively with other areas, as necessary Analytical Thinking: Develops frameworks to assure that “pros” and “cons” are evaluated, key issues are identified and detailed analysis is synthesized Creative Thinking: Sets a personal example of seeking out new and better ways of doing things Stays open to new ideas and approaches Generates new ideas Client orientation: Constantly hones understanding and responsiveness to internal and external client requirements, goals and issues Self-confidence and determination Manages most situations in a calm, steady, “can-do” manner Demonstrates self-confidence; resilient Demonstrates a focus on results over time; resourceful, tenacious Relationship building Takes the time to maintain relationships and create new ones Driving results: Manages projects, activities and resources according to search and team strategy effectively Sets priorities and reviews progress against goals regularly Multitasks effectively and efficiently Best practice perspective: Seeks to adopt best practices to increase effectiveness and organization competitiveness Eager to participate in the coaching and mentoring of new employees through formal and informal learning programs and relationships Possesses strong personal commitment to quality standards and meeting quality expectations Gives constructive feedback and recommends suggestions for improvement, where appropriate Organizational buy-in: Generates enthusiasm for Company strategies and key initiatives Energizes others with whom he/she is in regular contact Personal Characteristics Available to work Monday through Friday during normal office hours Demonstrates strong business ethics (honesty, integrity, confidentiality, discretion) in all situations Strong team player Maintains composure in fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Displays appropriate sense of humor in the workplace Flexible to work overtime, when needed Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Deine Aufgaben: Event- und Reiseplanung Kommunikationsmanagement Organisation von Meetings Prozessoptimierung Unterstützung im Business Development Kalender- und Kontaktpflege Dein Profil: Persönliche Eigenschaften : Einsatzbereitschaft und Teamgeist Kreativität : Kreative Lösungen für komplexe Herausforderungen Anpassungsfähigkeit : Flexibilität in neuen Situationen Sprachkenntnisse : Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Kompetenzen : Kommunikationsgeschick und Organisationstalent Technische Fähigkeiten : MS Office und moderne IT-Technik Deine Benefits: 📝 Unbefristete Festanstellung 🏝️ 30 Tage Urlaub 💻 Flexibles Arbeiten 💪 Kooperation mit Sport- und Fitnessanbietern 💰 Attraktive Bezahlung und Zusatzleistungen 🤓 Gezielte Förderung und Feedback Show more Show less

Title: Office Services Assistant
Description: Who You'll Work With You are someone who thrives in a high-performance environment, bringing a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle meaningful challenges that have a real impact. In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we’ll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities to help you quickly broaden your expertise, grow into a well-rounded professional, and contribute to work that truly makes a difference. When you join us, you will have: Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey. A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes. Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Exceptional benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family. Your Impact McKinsey is a global business consultancy that helps organizations achieve sustainable, inclusive growth. We work with clients in the private, public, and social sectors to solve complex problems and create positive change for all involved. We combine bold strategies and transformative technologies to help companies innovate more sustainably, achieve lasting performance improvements, and build workforces that will thrive for this generation and the next. In Germany and Austria, McKinsey has offices in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Cologne, Munich, Stuttgart, and Vienna. Globally, McKinsey teams work in more than 130 cities and 65 countries. At McKinsey, people with diverse career backgrounds work together. In Office Management, they include former translators, flight attendants, and hotel managers. As part of our three-person reception team, you will be the first point of contact in our Berlin office. You will quickly and flexibly help with all organizational tasks and ensure the seamless processing of our services. Among other responsibilities, you will manage room reservations for meetings, ensure optimal room planning, and make sure that every event room is equipped with the required technology. You will competently support colleagues and visitors from Germany and abroad before and after meetings – and provide reliable information at all times. At our switchboard, you will take phone calls and forward them to the correct contact person. In Facility Management, you will assist with various office projects, such as coordinating appointments with suppliers, supporting them during visits, creating key figure analyses, and preparing presentations and meeting minutes. You will also be responsible for administration and organization in the mailroom, including processing incoming and outgoing mail and providing office supplies and IT equipment. In addition, you will take on administrative tasks and process invoices for external services. From the outset, you will take on responsibility for your own special tasks. Together with the team, you will further enhance the high-quality standards of our office. With us, you will find challenging tasks in an exceptionally committed team, with many opportunities for further training and great scope for personal development. In addition to modern offices in exclusive locations and state-of-the-art equipment, we offer other interesting benefits (e.g., free meals) and company-supported health management (e.g., sports offerings). Performance-based compensation and attractive social benefits round out our offer. The position is initially for a fixed term of two years. Your Qualifications and Skills You have completed your commercial professional training, e.g., as a hotel manager, ideally from a reputable hotel business. You have initial experience of reception work, in the hotel industry or in other service industry areas. You demonstrate strong service orientation and an aptitude for dealing with people. You think and act in a structured and conscientious manner and possess excellent communication and teamwork skills. You have excellent organizational skills and can set appropriate priorities. You are reliable and flexible, quick to grasp new concepts, and have good judgment. With your positive demeanor, you remain calm and maintain oversight even in hectic situations. You are fluent in German, have excellent written and spoken English skills, and are experienced at using standard Microsoft Office applications. Ideally, you have a technical understanding and aptitude, enabling you to quickly familiarize yourself with new technologies. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Über uns: SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung – wir sind Ihr Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung. Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Sie lieben es, einem Team den Rücken frei zu halten, es zu entlasten und somit am Projekterfolg teilzuhaben? Dann suchen wir SIE! Im Auftrag eines renommierten Private Equity Unternehmens im Herzen Münchens, suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in unbefristeter Festanstellung (in Direktvermittlung, keine Arbeitnehmerüberlassung) eine/n Team Assistant (m/w/d) Ihr zukünftiges Unternehmen im Überblick: München: Unser Kunde zählt zu den weltweit führenden Private Equity Unternehmen mit Sitz im Herzen Münchens / Nähe Odeonsplatz. Verantwortungsbereich: Als Team Assistant (m/w/d) übernehmen Sie die Betreuung und Entlastung ihres Teams sowie die internationale Korrespondenz und sind erster Ansprechpartner intern sowie extern. Die Sicherstellung eines reibungslosen Informationsflusses zwischen internen Fachbereichen und externen Schnittstellen wie Kunden, Lieferanten, Dienstleistern liegt in Ihren Händen. Sie erledigen anspruchsvolle administrative Aufgaben wie Rechnungsstellung, Reisekostenabrechnung, die Koordination der Kalender (Termin- und Reiseplanung) und sorgen dabei für einen effizienten Ablauf aller Termine. Auch die Organisation von internen und externen Konferenzen, Meetings (virtuell/on-site) sowie Veranstaltungen liegt vertrauensvoll in Ihren Händen. Sie unterstützen bei der Erstellung und Aufbereitung von Unterlagen für Besprechungen, wie z.B. Investoren-Meetings und behalten dabei stets einen "kühlen" Kopf. Das wird Ihnen geboten: Eine unbefristete Festanstellung in Direktvermittlung bei einem angesehenen Arbeitgeber (Direktvermittlung, keine Arbeitnehmerüberlassung) Ein attraktiver Standort im Herzen von München Ein hochmoderner Arbeitsplatz Geregelte Arbeitszeiten von Mo – Fr, hybrides Arbeitsmodell Eine sehr gute Einarbeitung in Ihr zukünftiges Aufgabengebiet Ein Arbeitsumfeld, dass sich durch hohen Teamspirit auszeichnet und sich auf Sie freut Ein sehr gutes Gehaltspaket und weitere Benefits, wie z.B. Mitarbeiterkantine, Zuschuss zum Fitness-Studio, In-house Schulungsangebote Fahrtkostenübernahme sowie geschäftsjahresabhängiger Bonus Wir freuen uns auf Kandidaten, die Folgendes mitbringen: Eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum/zur Hotelfachfrau/mann (m/w/d), Management Assistent/in (m/w/d), Fremdsprachenkorrespondenten/in (m/w/d), Europasekretär/in (m/w/d) oder vergleichbare Ausbildung ODER: Ein entsprechend abgeschlossenes Studium, beispielsweise im Bereich Hotelmanagement / Tourismusmanagement / sprachwissenschaftliches Studium Sie verfügen optimalerweise über erste Berufserfahrung oder befinden sich kurz vor Abschluss Ihrer (kaufmännischen) Ausbildung in einer ähnlichen Position in einem international tätigen Umfeld, beispielsweise im Bereich Tourismus, gehobener Gastronomie, Hotellerie, Kreuzfahrtindustrie, Airline/Airport oder einer ähnlichen Dienstleistungsbranche Ihre sehr guten Deutsch- und guten bis sehr guten Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift setzen Sie sicher in Ihrem Berufsalltag ein Sie haben Freude an Ihrer Tätigkeit als Gastgeber & Teamassistenz (m/w/d) und bringen neben erstklassiger Dienstleistungsorientierung stets ein Lächeln mit Der Umgang mit Microsoft Office-Produkten ist Ihnen bestens vertraut Als Team Assistant (m/w/d) zeichnen Sie sich durch eine engagierte und kommunikationsstarke Persönlichkeit mit hohem Teamgeist aus Neugierig geworden? Dann freue ich mich auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen an E: n.linner@symbiorec.de Bei Fragen dürfen Sie sich jederzeit gerne unter T: +49 170 7656292 an mich wenden. Durch die SymBio Recruitment GmbH können Sie eine absolut vertrauliche Behandlung Ihrer Unterlagen erwarten, die nur nach vorheriger Absprache mit Ihnen weitergeleitet werden. Weil Sie uns wichtig sind, erhalten Sie von uns eine persönliche Beratung, die auf Ihre individuellen Karrierebedürfnisse abzielt. Sollte noch nicht die passende Vakanz dabei gewesen sein oder Sie an einem anderen Standort nach einer beruflichen Herausforderung suchen, freue ich mich auf Ihre Initiativ-Bewerbung. Egal, wo Sie in Deutschland beruflich durchstarten möchten – SymBio Recruitment GmbH ist Ihr verlässlicher Partner, der Sie auf Ihrem Weg unterstützt. Entdecken Sie mit uns neue berufliche Perspektiven und erleben Sie, wie wir Ihre Karriere gemeinsam gestalten. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant Global Investment Bank Munich, Bavaria We have just picked up a fantastic opportunity to join a global investment bank in Munich! Title: Administrative Assistant
Description: PIMCO is a global leader in active fixed income with deep expertise across public and private markets. We invest our clients’ capital across a range of fixed income and credit opportunities, leveraging our decades of experience navigating complex debt markets. Our flexible capital base and deep relationships with issuers have helped us become one of the world’s largest providers of traditional and nontraditional solutions for companies that need financing and investors who seek strong risk-adjusted returns. Since 1971, our people have shaped our organization through a high-performance inclusive culture, in which we celebrate diverse thinking. We invest in our people and strive to imprint our CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility and Excellence. We believe each of us is here to help others succeed and this has led to PIMCO being recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients. Position Description The Assistant will provide high-level support to a team of Investment Professionals throughout PIMCO Munich with their duties to include but not limited to: Proactively planning schedules and itineraries to take into account multiple time zones and conflicting calendars Extensive diary management, answering telephone calls and responding to ad hoc requests. Coordination of extensive travel bookings: flights, trains, visas and hotel accommodation. Ensuring that the traveller has all relevant information required and receive the necessary approvals Expense processing using Concur Research and other special projects as assigned by Investment Professionals Maintenance of the CRM database, maintaining contacts in a consistent format – proactively organizing and maintaining a good information retrieval system Point of contact: meet and greet clients and visitors as well as screening and redirecting telephone calls, responding on the IP’ behalf as required Meeting preparation: ensure the managers are fully briefed for all meetings with the relevant correspondence/paperwork. Open Zoom calls/meetings and ensure meeting rooms are prepared ahead of schedule Ad hoc projects to meet with the demands of the business Requirements This position requires a highly organized and flexible individual to work in a fast-paced environment managing a consistent high volume of work. Please submit CVs in English. Fluency in German and English is essential for this role Experience of working in a fast paced, global environment Knowledge of the financial services sector with a clear understanding of the industry preferable Time-keeping and flexibility Excellent attention to detail Strong communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to prioritize tasks and workload Ability to work effectively with senior executives Strong project and time management skills Positive, proactive approach with the ability to work in a professional manner Possess the ability to think outside the box, being one step ahead whilst working collaboratively Act as back-up to other assistants in times of absences Work discretely, professionally and calmly Advanced-level skills in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel Knowledge of Concur and CRM preferable Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Statement PIMCO recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity and expression), age, military or veteran status, disability (physical or mental), any factor prohibited by law, and as such affirms in policy and practice to support and promote the concept of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action, in accordance with all applicable federal, state, provincial and municipal laws. The company also prohibits discrimination on other basis such as medical condition, or marital status under applicable laws. Applicants with Disabilities PIMCO is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, including veterans, in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system due to a disability and you would like to request an accommodation, you may contact us at 949-720-7744 and leave a message. This is a dedicated line designed exclusively to assist job seekers with disabilities to apply online. Only messages left for this purpose will be considered. A response to your request may take up to two business days. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant - stunning, centrally located Frankfurt office! THE CLIENT Our client is a successful, independent investment firm operating across Europe. With a modern, centrally located office in Frankfurt, they operate with a collaborative tight-knit, high-performing team. As the firm continues to grow, they are looking for a reliable and proactive Team Assistant & Receptionist to provide full operational and front-office support to their Frankfurt team. THE ROLE Working alongside a wonderfully supportive Office Manager, the role will be hands-on and varied ideal for someone with a collaborative mindset. As the Team Assistant & Receptionist, you’ll play a pivotal role in keeping the office running smoothly, managing travel, events, and day-to-day coordination. You’ll be the face of the office and a vital support to the wider team — it’s a great opportunity for someone who enjoys being a 'go to' person. Duties will include but are not limited to: Managing and coordinating calendars and travel (national and international) Booking and supporting meetings, video calls, and conference calls Processing expenses for the Frankfurt team Organising team events (e.g. off-sites, team days) Preparing and formatting documents and presentations (Word and PowerPoint) in both German and English Welcoming guests, setting up meeting rooms, and arranging catering Maintaining a presentable reception, kitchen, and communal area Handling daily post, filing, and general office admin Ordering supplies and managing stock inventory Covering for colleagues during holidays Reproducing and binding documents and presentation packs KEY REQUIREMENTS 3+ years’ experience in a similar Team Assistant/Administrative role Fluent in German and English, both spoken and written Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel Excellent organisational and multitasking skills Friendly, dependable, and highly professional Strong attention to detail and the ability to follow procedures Proactive and enthusiastic with a “can-do” attitude Confident communicator, able to liaise comfortably with internal and external stakeholders Experience working across multiple teams BENEFITS Hugely competitive salary and bonus potential, plus benefits including: • Annual discretionary bonus • 30 days’ holiday • Job Ticket • Gym Membership • Bright, modern office in Frankfurt’s city centre • Flat hierarchy and agile working style • A positive team culture that encourages personal ownership and initiative Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: A rare opportunity for an Assistant seeking a varied and dynamic role in Frankfurt's Bankenviertel! It can't be overstated that every day working for this boutique investment firm will be different... This will suit you if you enjoy working in an everchanging environment, adapting to shifting priorities and have the ability to think outside the box. You must have fluent German & advanced English language skills. You'll work alongside the Office Manager / Senior Executive Assistant who is an expert in her field, with more than 20 years supporting at the most senior level, and she is keen to share information, help you to upskill and support your career development. She has a wonderful balance of professionalism and fun - and she's looking for a great teammate! In return, you'll be rewarded with a highly competitive salary, target-driven bonuses, career development and a role that will allow you to add real value. You will enjoy this role if you like working in a smaller (yet very chic!) office environment. This will be office-based 5 days per week during Probezeit, with home office opportunity upon successful completion. The Role You will support the Managing Director, and work very closely with the Senior Executive Assistant / Office Manager to support with office and project management. Core duties include: Calendar coordination & inbox management Travel arrangements Organisation of meetings Preparation of presentations Handling sensitive legal, financial & personnel documentation Expenses, invoicing Arranging events Ad-hoc projects Ensuring the smooth running of the office alongside the Office Manager Covering for the Office Manager when she is away To be considered for this role, these are essential skills and attributes: Demonstrate experience in high-level service-oriented environments (such as completed your Hotelfachfrau/mann Ausbildung in 5* hotels), or worked as an Assistant in a similar boutique environment Demonstrate previous experience working with high-net-worth individuals / senior executives Possess fluent German and advanced English skills Comprehensive MS Office knowledge Excellent organisational and administrative skills Enjoy and work well in an ever-changing environment with moving deadlines Ability to problem-solve and use initiative Possess a professional and calm demeanour Impeccable attention to detail Exercise discretion and confidentiality If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Title: Office Administrator
Description: Office Administrator About Us Greenman Energy is a company within the Greenman Group, specialising in the installation and operation of photovoltaic systems and fast-charging stations for electric vehicles. Currently, we are deploying our systems across approximately 100 supermarkets owned by the Greenman OPEN fund, but in the coming years, we plan to expand our portfolio to include third-party properties. The Position The Office Administrator will provide administrative support to the office. This includes office organisation, managing reception, post, documentation, invoices, trip and construction site planning/organisation, and customer service both internally and externally to ensure smooth operation of the office. Responsibilities Coordinate and organise office activities Oversee stock of office supplies Greet visitors at office Coordinate inbound and outbound office mail Organise documents Reach out to business contacts via phone Manage invoices Skills Great time management and organisational skills Outstanding abilities to communicate in person, in writing and over the phone German language skill (English is a plus) Proficient with Microsoft Office software and phone systems Your Profile We are looking for a positive, organised, and goal-oriented individual who thrives in a start-up environment and understands the career growth opportunities that come with the company’s expansion. Title: Office Administrator
Description: Location: FibreCoat GmbH, Philipsstraße, 8, Aachen, Germany About FibreCoat: FibreCoat is an innovative and fast-growing start-up based in Aachen. We are pioneering high-performance materials that are affordable and sustainable. With a dynamic, international team and a results-driven culture, we are shaping the future of advanced materials for various industries. Job Description: As an Office Administrator at FibreCoat , you will play a key role in keeping our daily operations running smoothly. You will be responsible for supporting administrative processes, coordinating office activities, and assisting various departments to ensure an organised, efficient, and positive work environment. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys variety, takes initiative, and thrives in a growing, fast-paced company. Responsibilities Retrieve, open, and sort physical mail from designated mailboxes Distribute incoming correspondence to the appropriate team members Answer and screen incoming calls to the main office line Monitor, restock, and order kitchen and office supplies as needed Ensure the office and kitchen areas are tidy, organised, and visitor-ready Refill drinks and snacks in communal areas and meeting rooms Water indoor plants regularly to maintain a pleasant office atmosphere Liaise with the landlord to ensure cleaning services are carried out effectively Monitor and maintain general digital mailboxes Support the organisation of internal events Provide general support to the Administration team on day-to-day operations Qualifications Prior experience in office administration or a similar role is a plus Strong organisational and multitasking skills Proficient with MS Office and comfortable with digital tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German is a big plus) Friendly, reliable, and solution-oriented mindset Ability to multitask, organise, and prioritise work What We Offer: The chance to make a tangible impact on sustainable development and innovation in the high-performance materials industry A dynamic and diverse work environment with a collaborative international team Creative freedom and responsibility in a young and growing company Opportunities for personal and professional growth in a rapidly expanding market Competitive salary and benefits package ESOP options ( Employee Stock Ownership Plan ) A modern and welcoming office space Snack bar, team activities, and home office opportunities 30 vacation days per year Show more Show less

Title: Administrative Assistant Hr (Mensch)
Description: Additional Information Job Number 25104042 Job Category Administrative Location The Ritz-Carlton Wolfsburg, Parkstrasse 1, Wolfsburg, Lower Saxony, Germany, 38440VIEW ON MAP Schedule Full Time Located Remotely? N Position Type Non-Management Ihr The Ritz-Carlton, Wolfsburg Karriereauto ist startklar. Steigen Sie ein und geben Sie richtig Gas. Bei uns gibt es keine Geschwindigkeitsbegrenzung. Wir sind Ihr Highway to Success. Genießen Sie während der ersten Orientierungstage die Aussicht und lassen Sie erst einmal uns das Steuer übernehmen. Danach wechseln Sie zum Begleiteten Fahren – während Ihrer intensiven Einarbeitung stehen wir Ihnen zur Seite und unterstützen Sie auf den ersten Strecken. Sobald Sie uns das Zeichen geben, dass Sie sich sicher fühlen, überlassen wir Ihnen die Fahrt. Dann stehen Ihnen alle Routen offen – Sie entscheiden über Geschwindigkeit und Ziel. IHRE ERSTE ROUTE: Unterstützung des Human Resources Teams im administrativen Tagesgeschäft Pflege von Mitarbeiterdaten, Führung digitaler Personalakten und Verwaltung vertraulicher Unterlagen Vorbereitung von Arbeitsverträgen, Bescheinigungen und weiteren personalrelevanten Dokumenten Organisation von Onboarding-Prozessen und Begrüßung neuer Ladies & Gentlemen im Haus Terminplanung und Koordination von Vorstellungsgesprächen und internen Schulungen Unterstützung bei der Vorbereitung von Veranstaltungen und HR-Initiativen Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen im Sinne unserer werteorientierten Unternehmenskultur IHR KOFFERRAUM IST GEFÜLLT MIT: Teamfähigkeit und Engagement Erste Berufserfahrung in einer administrativen oder HR-nahen Funktion wünschenswert Diskretion und ein sicheres Gespür für den Umgang mit vertraulichen Informationen Organisationsstärke und sorgfältige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch Freude am Umgang mit Menschen und hoher Servicegedanke Gute Kenntnisse in MS Office UNSERE FAHRASSISTENTEN SIND: werteorientierte Unternehmenskultur Verpflegung in unserem Mitarbeiterrestaurant mit Außenterrasse Reinigung der zur Verfügung gestellten Uniform Vergünstigungen bei Hotelübernachtungen (Mitarbeiterrate, Family & Friends-Raten), F&B, Retail, etc. innerhalb Marriott International mitarbeiterfreundliche Dienstplangestaltung, angemessenes Gehalt + Sonderzahlungen Über uns: Marriott tritt als Arbeitgeber für Chancengleichheit ein. Wir engagieren uns für die Einstellung einer vielfältigen Belegschaft und eine nachhaltige, inklusive Kultur, in der die Mitarbeiter an erster Stelle stehen. Wir verpflichten uns, Personen mit einem Schutzstatus, zum Beispiel Behinderung und Veteranenstatus, oder einem anderen gesetzlich geschützten Status nicht zu diskriminieren. At more than 100 award-winning properties worldwide, The Ritz-Carlton Ladies and Gentlemen create experiences so exceptional that long after a guest stays with us, the experience stays with them. Attracting the world’s top hospitality professionals who curate lifelong memories, we believe that everyone succeeds when they are empowered to be creative, thoughtful and compassionate. Every day, we set the standard for rare and special luxury service the world over and pride ourselves on delivering excellence in the care and comfort of our guests. Your role will be to ensure that the “Gold Standards” of The Ritz-Carlton are delivered graciously and thoughtfully every day. The Gold Standards are the foundation of The Ritz-Carlton and are what guides us each day to be better than the next. It is this foundation and our belief that our culture drives success by which The Ritz Carlton has earned the reputation as a global brand leader in luxury hospitality. As part of our team, you will learn and exemplify the Gold Standards, such as our Employee Promise, Credo and our Service Values. And our promise to you is that we offer the chance to be proud of the work you do and who you work with. In joining The Ritz-Carlton, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you. Show more Show less

Title: Business Assistant
Description: Job Description This role is a great opportunity to demonstrate strong background as an Executive Assistant, with experience working with senior stakeholders in an office environment. This role requires a high degree of flexibility, confidentiality, and a strong work ethic. If your strong skills are excellent time management, resourcefulness, diligence, and a focus on business and client deliverables, then apply for this position! As a Senior Executive Assistant within our EMEA Currencies & Emerging Markets division, you will support senior stakeholders, demonstrating solid background as an Senior Executive Assistant, flexibility, confidentiality, and a strong work ethic. This role demands excellent time management, resourcefulness, diligence, and a focus on business and client deliverables. Job Responsibilities Manage advanced diary tasks by proactively handling internal and external meetings, conference calls, and organizing events such as Off-Sites, Town Halls, and Skip-Levels. Coordinate travel and entertainment by partnering with relevant groups to book arrangements, ensuring compliance with CIB/Firmwide policies. Handle client interactions by managing internal and external communications, coordinating department schedules and transactional activities. Process expenses by collaborating with teams to manage costs, enforcing policies, and ensuring timely handover of required information. Collaborate cross-functionally with business management and key stakeholders across lines of business (LoB). Utilize internal systems for accurate data entry, reporting, and information collation. Oversee administrative tasks such as managing distribution lists and technology usage. Integrate into the business by understanding group priorities and expectations. Partner with assistants across LoB to provide coverage as needed. Participate in PowerPoint presentations, projects, and training based on performance. Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills Demonstrate language proficiency by being fluent in German and English. Build and maintain business relationships through professional client handling. Apply good judgment in diary management and understand competing priorities, manage time efficiently through effective scheduling. Communicate effectively with strong written and verbal skills. Arrange travel by creating itineraries and optimizing time and costs. Exhibit high-level technical skills, understand expense systems and cost control initiatives. Maintain a polished, calm, and composed manner, able to work under pressure. Adapt to change with flexibility, act as a team player, being solution-oriented with the potential to serve as a role model. Deliver high-quality results with attention to detail; show proactivity and ownership by demonstrating initiative and responsibility within the role. Grasp the investment bank culture and political landscape quickly. Stay current with CIB/Firmwide policies and ensure compliance. ABOUT US J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. Title: Back Office Administrator
Description: Join our dynamic team in Munich as a Back Office Administrator. MERMEC Deutschland is a dynamic and growing company in the rail sector. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and enjoy a variety of responsibilities, in a business unit in growth. We are seeking a detail-oriented and dependable Back Office Administrator to ensure the smooth running of daily office operations. The ideal candidate will be well-organized, collaborative, and capable of supporting multiple teams, including HR, in a fast-paced, international environment. Responsibilities: Manage document processing, data entry, and digital filing systems Maintain and update databases and internal records Support internal communication and coordination between departments Handle inquiries and correspondence internally and externally Oversee office supplies and infrastructure, ensuring everything runs smoothly Assist in preparing reports and administrative documents Organize internal events and provide support for employee onboarding Coordinate with departments such as HR for operational support Support a multicultural environment (experience with Italian and French is a plus) Qualifications: Completed commercial training or similar qualification Experience in a back office or administrative role is preferred Strong organizational skills with attention to detail Team player with good communication skills Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Fluent in German and English (written and spoken) Ability to manage multiple tasks and adapt quickly to new challenges We are looking forward for your application! Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager:In
Description: Im Kundenauftrag suchen wir am Standort Frankfurt eine Office Manager:in (m/w/d). Aufgabenbereich: Übernahme administrativer Aufgaben im Bereich des allgemeinen Office Managements Einkauf von Büromaterialien (Möbel, Schreibwaren, Verbrauchsmaterialien) Unterstützung bei Reiseplanung und -organisation Ansprechpartner für Vermieter / Reinigungspersonal / Handwerker Vertretung und Unterstützung der Empfangsassistenz Fachliche Anforderungen: Abgeschlossene Ausbildung in der Hotellerie oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation Berufserfahrung im Empfangs- oder Office-Management von Vorteil Organisationstalent mit einer strukturierten, selbstständigen und vorausschauenden Arbeitsweise Freundliches und professionelles Auftreten Sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse ((Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Serviceorientierung und Teamfähigkeit Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Unser Partner-Unternehmen bietet: Eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe, die direkten Einfluss auf den Wachstumskurs des Unternehmens hat Direkte Berichtslinie an die Geschäftsführung, flache Hierarchien und ein junges Team Zeitliche & monetäre Unterstützung bei Weiterbildungen Vielfältige, kreative, sympathische, professionelle Teams und Kollegen Teamevents wie mehrtägige Firmenausflüge, Firmenlauf etc. Weitere Benefits wie: Getränke, Obstkorb, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Gesundheitsfürsorge, Massage-Service etc. Gehaltsrahmen in Vollzeit je nach Berufserfahrung: 44.000 -50.000 € Show more Show less

Title: Administrative Assistentin
Description: Als Projektassistent:in unterstützen Sie das Projektteam in organisatorischen und dokumentationsbezogenen Aufgaben. Sie tragen wesentlich zum reibungslosen Ablauf der Projekte bei und sorgen für die Einhaltung von Prozessen und Standards. Aufgaben Erstellung von Bedarfsanforderungen nach Vorgabe durch Systemverantwortliche Nachverfolgung von Dokumentenlieferungen an und vom Kunden Sicherstellung der Einhaltung formaler Anforderungen bei der Übermittlung von Dokumenten Formale Prüfung eingehender und ausgehender Dokumente (z. B. Version, Status, Änderungskennzeichnung, Zeichnungsköpfe, Unterschriften) Vorbereitung und Organisation von Projektbesprechungen (Teilnehmerliste, Agenda, Ort, Zeit) Erstellung von Präsentationen und Protokollen Nachverfolgung offener Punkte aus Projektbesprechungen Erstellung offizieller Schriftstücke sowie Status- und Fortschrittsberichte Terminverfolgung von Lieferungen, Leistungen und deren Voraussetzungen Erstellung von Terminplänen auf Basis definierter Vorlagen Erforderliche Qualifikationen: Abgeschlossene fachspezifische Berufsausbildung (mind. 3 Jahre) mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung oder Abgeschlossene fachfremde Ausbildung mit mehrjähriger fachspezifischer Erfahrung und ergänzender Weiterbildung 2–3 Jahre einschlägige Erfahrung in der Projektarbeit Erwünschte Qualifikationen: Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Erfahrung mit gängigen Systemen (z. B. ERP, Dokumentenmanagement) Zusätzliche Anforderungen: Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit Teamfähigkeit und Organisationstalent Selbstständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: About The Opportunity Job Type: Permanent Application Deadline: 18 July 2025 Title Team Assistant Department Distribution Germany Location Kronberg im Taunus Reports To Head of Distribution Central Region and ETF and Index Distribution, Europe Level Grade 4 We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Germany Distribution team and feel like you’re part of something bigger. About Your Role To provide secretarial and administrative support to the Distribution Heads in Germany, partnering with them to understand their requirements and priorities, being proactive in planning ahead and anticipating needs with regard to the activities described below: Managing schedules efficiently and in a timely manner, with a client-focused approach. Scheduling and booking travel and meeting itineraries. You will take care to provide detailed instructions, covering every detail of the arrangements, including providing contingency contact numbers in case of unexpected changes or delays to plans. Planning events such as off-sites or departmental meetings. You will take care of all logistical details. Communication. You will need to liaise effectively and professionally with all contacts, both internally and externally. This may involve disseminating or collating information, or co-ordinating events and meetings. Given the international context, effective liaison between different offices across the geographical boundaries is essential. PPT/reports About You Experience as a Team Assistant, ideally in a complex, fast moving environment Excellent organisation skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with people at all levels displaying good judgement when interacting with employees, colleagues, managers, clients and third parties Ability to demonstrate initiative and flexibility and to prioritise work appropriately Strong MS office skills will be required, particularly advanced skills in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Good team skills are essential, the PA will work closely with other PAs across the organisation Process orientation – to achieve consistency and reliability where this is of value, adopting best practice processes at every opportunity Fluency in English and German Feel rewarded For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant (m/f/d) Private Equity Firm Munich A global private equity firm in central Munich with a strong team of Assistants is seeking 2 new Executive Assistants / Team Assistants to support investment professionals in a busy firm. These are full secretarial & administrative roles, requiring a strong team player who enjoys working at a fast pace. You must have worked in an international firm or in 5-star hospitality in a support role, for example on reception, administration or events, and speak German & English to a fluent level - this is essential for this role! This firm offers incredible benefits to their employees, in terms of remuneration, well-being, opportunity to travel and work in their European offices, and career progression. They will support you by helping with relocation costs if you are moving to Munich. THE FIRM My client is a global investment firm with offices based in the heart of Munich and all across Europe, Asia and North America. They pride themselves on their values: being respectful, friendly, entrepreneurial, and they operate across a very flat structure. They only invest into firms that will do good, and firms with values aligned to their own, and they are very charitable and care about sustainability (and can prove it!) making this a very special place to work. This is a hugely supportive and collaborative environment, with encouragement to learn more and develop your skill set. THE ROLE You will support 3-5 investment professionals of varying seniority, and you're encouraged to take on wider projects if you would like to. The main duties are: Managing multiple diaries and arranging meetings across time zones Coordinating and booking international travel with often complex itineraries and last minute changes Processing expenses Replying to emails in German and English on behalf of the team Document management (signatures, printing, binding) Occasional event organisation for the local teams Anything ad-hoc that's needed to ensure the job gets done THE CANDIDATE This is an environment that values team work and you must enjoy working in a team. They look for very humble, intelligent, professional and friendly candidates who enjoy a fast paced environment and who want to learn, not afraid to ask questions. To be successful in this role, you must: Be service-oriented, with some experience in a similar administrative or organisational role, or have worked in hospitality / events Possess fluent German and English language skills Be able to build professional relationships Have the ability to prioritise and handle multiple requests Be resilient and calm when there are last-minute changes Be a team player Have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail Have good knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Value the role of an Assistant THE PACKAGE On top of a competitive base salary (in line with experience) there are the following benefits: Hugely generous performance-related bonus Annual salary review Company pay into a private pension Wellness benefits including gym membership Travel to work paid for Mobile phone for business and personal use Home office budget Annual Christmas & Summer parties in Munich & London Annual ski conference Free food and drinks all day, lunch cooked for you onsite 30 days' holiday, plus public holidays Relocation support if you are moving to Munich! If this is for you, please apply today! Show more Show less

Title: Administrative Coordinator
Description: Unser Kunde ist ein mittelständisches Pharmaunternehmen und sucht zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt administrative Unterstützung. Ihr Aufgabenbereich: administrativer Support der Abteilung in allen Belangen: Termin- und Reisekoordination sowie Reisekostenabrechnung Unterstützung bei der Organisation von Besprechungen und Veranstaltungen Erstellen von Verträgen und Kooperationsvereinbarungen Kosten- und Leistungsabrechnung Budgetcontrolling Ihr Profil: Mehrjährige Expertise in administrativen und organisatorischen Aufgaben Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Fundierte Erfahrung im Umgang mit MS-Office, insbesondere Excel, PowerPoint und Word Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte schnell zu erfassen, präzise umzusetzen und eigenverantwortlich sowie vorausschauend zu agieren Weitere Details: Start zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Anstellung in Vollzeit mit hybridem Arbeitsmodell Innovatives und dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Zur Unterstützung unseres Standortes in München suchen wir ein aufgeschlossenes und engagiertes, kommunikationsstarkes Organisationstalent. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass Kooperation und Vertrauen zwischen allen Teammitgliedern die Grundlage für herausragende Ergebnisse sind. Als Team Assistant (m/w/d) ermöglichst Du die reibungslose interne Zusammenarbeit, kommunizierst mit unseren Dienstleistern und Kunden, und entwickelst unsere wachsende Unternehmenskultur: unternehmerisch, leidenschaftlich und respektvoll. Aufgaben Du übernimmst ab dem ersten Tag Verantwortung und erfüllst dabei die folgenden zentralen Funktionen: Verantwortung der Büroorganisation zur Förderung effizienter Teamarbeit Verantwortung für eine ganzheitliche Wohlfühlatmosphäre als Ratgeber des Teams Korrespondenz und Steuerung von Dienstleister*Innen im Bereich Office-Management Unterstützung bei der Vorbereitung, Durchführung und Nachbereitung von Terminen, Veranstaltungen und Events Organisation von Geschenken für Geburtstage oder Feierlichkeiten im Team Termin- und Reisemanagement der Geschäftsleitung Vorbereitende Buchhaltung Eigenständige Bearbeitung der Korrespondenz Gästebetreuung und Bestellwesen Koordination und Unterstützung im Recruiting neuer Talente, sowie Zuarbeit für unser HR Weiterentwicklung der Unternehmenskultur bei Bloom Partners zusammen mit dem Management Team Positionierung unserer Arbeit, Studien und Beiträge auf digitalen Kanälen, bei Partnern und Events Qualifikation Andere Menschen zu unterstützen, bereitet Dir persönliche Freude. Du bist exzellent darin, zu kommunizieren, zu organisieren, gleichzeitig mehrere Bälle in der Luft zu halten hast erste professionelle Erfahrungen in der Unterstützung von Teams in einer dynamischen Umgebung gewinnen können. Idealerweise verfügst du dabei über folgende Eigenschaften: 2-5 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung (z.B. Unternehmensberatung, Start-Ups, Venture Capital, Marketing- oder HR-Funktionen eines Konzerns) Fließende Kenntnisse der deutschen und englischen Sprache in Wort und Schrift Exzellente organisatorische Fähigkeiten – positiv, entspannt und hands-on Strukturiertes Denken kombiniert mit einer positiven Ausstrahlung und einer kundenorientierten Arbeitsweise Empathie, Selbstbewusstsein und Erfahrung zum Aufbau von Vertrauen im Team Die Motivation, Teil einer schnelllebigen, wachsenden und unternehmerischen Beratung zu sein. Benefits WIR BIETEN DIR Eine inspirierende Arbeitsumgebung, in der Du wirklich Einfluss hast und unser Team tatkräftig unterstützt Ownership & die Möglichkeit deine Meinung, deine Fähigkeiten und deine Innovationskraft einzubringen Home Office Flexibilität, inkl. Flexibler Arbeitszeitmodelle Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget Wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt Guter Kununu-Score (4,2) und hohe Weiterempfehlungsrate (88%) Werde Teil von Bloom Partners in München! Unterstütze unser dynamisches Team als Team Assistant und treibe die digitale Transformation voran. Bewirb dich jetzt und wachse mit uns! Show more Show less

Title: Assistent:In
Description: Über uns: SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung – wir sind Ihr Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung. Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Im Office-Bereich besetzen wir u.a. für unsere Kunden folgende Positionen - in Voll- und Teilzeit: Fremdsprachenkorrespondenten (m/w/d), Europasekretäre (m/w/d), bi-/trilinguale Assistenzen (m/w/d), Executive/Management Assistants (m/w/d), Personal Assistants (m/w/d), Assistenzen der Geschäftsleitung (m/w/d), Office Manager (m/w/d), Übersetzer (m/w/d), Vorstandsassistenzen (m/w/d), Projektassistenten (m/w/d), Rechtsanwaltsfachangestellte (m/w/d), Rechtsfachwirte (m/w/d), Notarfachangestellte (m/w/d), Teamassistenzen (m/w/d), Patentsanwaltsfachangestellte (m/w/d), Paralegals (m/w/d), Empfangsassistenzen (m/w/d), Front Office Coordinators (m/w/d), EA Manager (m/w/d), Abendsekretäre (m/w/d)... Unsere Kunden sind international tätige Unternehmen verschiedenster Branchen und Größen deutschlandweit , welche wir aktiv bei der Suche nach ausgebildeten Fachkräften (m/w/d) in Voll- und Teilzeit unterstützen. Wir verstehen uns als Brückenbauer zwischen Ihnen und Ihrem zukünftigen Arbeitgeber . Wir freuen uns auf Kandidaten (m/w/d), die Folgendes mitbringen: Eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung als Bürokauffrau/mann (m/w/d), Fremdsprachenkorrespondent/in (m/w/d), Europasekretär/in (m/w/d), Rechtsanwaltsfachangestellte/r (m/w/d), Notar- oder Patentanwaltsfachangestellte/r (m/w/d), Management Assistant (m/w/d), Übersetzer/in (m/w/d), Industriekauffrau/kaufmann (m/w/d), Veranstaltungskauffrau/kaufmann (m/w/d), Hotelkauffrau/mann (m/w/d), Hotelbetriebswirt/in (m/w/d), oder ein betriebswirtschaftliches / sprachwissenschaftliches Studium oder vergleichbare Ausbildung / Erfahrung Erste Erfahrung am Empfang bzw. im Assistenz- / Sekretariatsbereich (gerne auch Quer- oder Berufseinstieg) oder auch fundierte EA Erfahrung, beispielsweise in 1-to-1 Zuordnungen Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse Sichere MS-Office Kenntnisse Ein ausgeprägtes Organisationstalent sowie die Fähigkeit, "viele Bälle gleichzeitig über Wasser zu halten" Eine Arbeitsweise, die sich durch eine hohe Qualität und die Bereitschaft sich in neue Sachverhalte einzuarbeiten, auszeichnet Freude an Ihrem Beruf Tätigkeitsbereich: Sie fungieren gerne als Schnittstelle zwischen verschiedenen Fachbereichen sowie erster Ansprechpartner für Kunden, Dienstleister und Geschäftspartner? Sie arbeiten gerne im internationalen Kontext, möchten erste Berufserfahrung im Empfangs- oder dem Bereich Office Management sammeln oder haben bereits fundierte Erfahrung als Executive Assistant (m/w/d) / Personal Assistant (m/w/d) /Vorstandsassistenz (m/w/d)? Ihre Kollegen bezeichnen Sie als Allround-Talent im Büro? Sie haben Freude an Ihrer Rolle als Office Assistant (m/w/d), bringen eine pro-aktive und dienstleistungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit? Dann suchen wir SIE in direkter Festanstellung (keine Arbeitnehmerüberlassung) für unsere Kunden in den verschiedensten Branchen mit attraktiven Gehalts- und Benefit-Paketen. Neugierig geworden? Dann freue ich mich auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen an E: n.linner@symbiorec.de Bei Fragen dürfen Sie sich jederzeit gerne unter T: +49 170 7656292 an mich wenden. Durch die SymBio Recruitment GmbH können Sie eine absolut vertrauliche Behandlung Ihrer Unterlagen erwarten, die nur nach vorheriger Absprache mit Ihnen weitergeleitet werden. Weil Sie uns wichtig sind, erhalten Sie von uns eine persönliche Beratung, die auf Ihre individuellen Karrierebedürfnisse abzielt. Sollte noch nicht die passende Vakanz dabei gewesen sein oder Sie an einem anderen Standort nach einer beruflichen Herausforderung suchen, freue ich mich auf Ihre Initiativ-Bewerbung. Egal, wo Sie in Deutschland beruflich durchstarten möchten – SymBio Recruitment GmbH ist Ihr verlässlicher Partner, der Sie auf Ihrem Weg unterstützt. Entdecken Sie mit uns neue berufliche Perspektiven und erleben Sie, wie wir Ihre Karriere gemeinsam gestalten. Show more Show less

Title: Administrative Assistant For Office In Munich
Description: At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation. Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive. We value our employees and act in a team-oriented and innovative manner. We emphasize diversity and think globally. Reliability, trustworthiness, and openness are important to us, as well as a high level of integrity. Overview: This position is an all-rounder role that is entrusted with independent tasks handling and projects within its competencies. You will take responsibility for a wide and interesting range of tasks in an international company and you will support the Regional Sales Vice President with administrative and organizational tasks as well as manage our Munich office. Your Tasks: Manage the reception, including the central telephone for the Munich office Support our Regional Sales Vice President with administrative and operational tasks (travel expense management, travel management, meeting minutes, independent coordination and arrangement of visits from international guests, organization of company events, appointment coordination) Manage the marketing storage and ensure timely shipping of marketing items to event locations, order management for marketing items in alignment with the marketing team Handle office management tasks: email management, document maintenance (contracts, orders, telephone lists, etc.), ordering and managing office supplies Be the first point of contact for our guests Planning and execution of organizational tasks for events, seminars, conferences and meetings Create cost statements Facility management and coordination of facility tasks with external service providers Take responsibility for all health and safety issues (first aid, fire protection) in the office, as well as reporting accidents Prepare meeting and office rooms and ensure a representative appearance, manage room bookings Collaborate and align with various departments such as sales, marketing, finance, and IT Your Profile: You have excellent and verifiable skills in planning, organization, and administration You work very independently, proactively, and reliably Excellent written and verbal communication skills Very good German and English language skills Advanced knowledge of Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Internet High service orientation & flexibility Team orientation Experience with safety regulations (first aid, fire protection) is an advantage Very good skills in prioritizing many different tasks Proactivity, solution orientation, and very good skills in dealing with various parties (employees, managers, guests, service providers) Existing first aid training or willingness to undergo training The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change. Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com) . Equal Employment Opportunity It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. F5 offers a variety of reasonable accommodations for candidates. Requesting an accommodation is completely voluntary. F5 will assess the need for accommodations in the application process separately from those that may be needed to perform the job. Request by contacting accommodations@f5.com. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant (m/w/d)* Unser Kunde entwickelt ganzheitliche Leadership-Lösungen für alle Unternehmen, die sich dem Wandel der Zeit stellen. Er ist in knapp 40 Ländern der Erde vertreten. Das Aufgabenportfolio unseres Kunden, der im Herzen Frankfurts sitzt, umfasst Executive Search, Assessments, Führungskräfteentwicklung sowie die gezielte Weiterentwicklung von Teams, Unternehmenskulturen und Organisationen. Für dieses anspruchsvolle, interessante Unternehmen am Standort in Frankfurt am Main, suchen wir Sie, einen Executive Assistant (m/w/d), welcher stark im Priorisieren ist, eigenständig und selbstbewusst mit Weitsicht Probleme löst, bevor sie überhaupt entstehen. Diese Position bieten wir Ihnen zum schnellstmöglichen Zeitpunkt im Rahmen der unbefristeten Festanstellung an. Ihre Position: Sie arbeiten 1:1 mit einem Berater und übernehmen die Verantwortung für einen reibungslosen Büroablauf Sie übernehmen die komplexe Projektkoordination Sie sind die verlässliche Schnittstelle zu unterschiedlichen Unternehmensbereichen Die Korrespondenz auf deutscher sowie englischer Sprache gehört ebenso zu Ihrem Aufgabengebiet Sie übernehmen die Vorbereitung der Projektdokumentation und die Überarbeitung zusammen mit den anderen Projektmitgliedern sowie die Projektfinalisierung vor dem Versand Ihre Qualifikation: Sie besitzen eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische Berufsausbildung oder ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit Erfahrung im Assistenzbereich Interkulturelle Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe gehören zu Ihren Stärken Gleichermaßen vereinen Sie die Liebe zum Detail und legen dabei den Blick aufs große Ganze Sie arbeiten zügig, flexibel und selbstständig, setzen dabei Prioritäten und finden schnell Lösungen Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie sehr gute MS Office-Kenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freut sich Frau Claudia van Kaick auf Ihre qualifizierte und aussagekräftige Bewerbung. Bei Fragen zum beschriebenen Stellenangebot ist Frau Claudia van Kaick gerne für Sie da. claudia.vankaick@timeconsult.de +49 (0) 69 95 11 18-0 * Zur besseren Lesbarkeit wird in diesem Schreiben nur die männliche Bezeichnung verwendet.
